reviews.review: Sahara sunsets for the win . Highly recommended desert excursion, great value for the price. Just returned from the 2-day Zagora desert/Atlas mountain tour. Booked the day before, w/ excellent communication. Tour guide and driver were excellent, although we made several stops we never felt rushed. Left a lot of options open for us to decide on our own to customize tour for us, even bargained with the locals for souvenirs. Rode camels through desert in the sunset, the sunrise in the morning was unreal. Food was amazing, A+++

Wonderful day!. Just got home from an great day with Abdul. We did the day trip to the Atlas Mountains. Booking was easy and communication was great with Mohammed before our excursion. Would highly recommend a day outside of the city learning more about the Berber culture. We drove out of the city and stopped first to have breakfast with a Berber family then a little further went for a short camel ride. Then drive through the mountains and rode miles up to the waterfall then to an amazing lunch with a Berber family. Hiked back down then drove to the other side of the mountain for some ATV's then home. Long day, but so much fun and learned a lot. Thanks Abdul and Morocco Active Adventures for an awesome day!

Unforgettable Tour through Morocco. We did a private tour for two. We booked the three days trip starting in Marrakech over Ait Ben Haddou, Ouarzazate, Tinghir and Erfoud to Merzouga. The way back we took the route a bit more south passing amongst others Tazzarine, Nkob and Zagora. The booking we did from Germany was really easy and Mohamed from the agency answered all our questions we had upfront really quickly. Starting from the very first moment when our guide and driver Abdul picked us up we felt really safe and comfortable at all times. Abdul gave us interesting information and answered all of our many questions with pleasure. No matter where we stopped, we enjoyed great food and clean sanitary facilities.To stay at the hotel Xaluca was another highlight on this perfect trip which could only be topped by the camel riding and the night in the dessert camp with the friendly staff. We enjoyed a great night with a group of about 12 other tourists from different countries including african live music. Visiting a nomadic family in a mountains cave gave us an impression of local living conditions what we found interesting. By the way, Abdul is a very good driver which we find important given the winding roads in Morocco. We are more than happy with our decision to have booked the trip at Morocco Active Adventures and can recommend it without hesitation. Special thanks to Abdul who made this trip unforgettable to us.

Thanks Said ! Fun 3 days. great three days tour in the desert. The team was very flexible and adjusted to our special schedule. Said was great company. It is very important as we spend a lot of time driving. Thankss

Friendly staff and great experience. We booked a 3-day-tour from Marrakech to Marrakesh. Everything was amazing!Tour guide Rachid, was every helpful. He plan things ahead and therefore managed to change our original plan based on the weather conditions. Listen to us carefully and answer all kind of questions. Unlike most tour guide, he does not force us to buy anything or treat us differently based on our "performance". Instead, he observed our real interests and introduced some really nice local shops when we need. Always on time and detail oriented (he always make sure there is enough toilet paper before he show me the way to the toilet...)The sand tour was bravo! Staffs at camp site were very friendly and versatile. After the dinner, there was a bonfire party, with great live music from staff, incl original Africa songs with drones and pop music with guitar. The dromedary guide Hamd's strong will to learn Mandarin was impressive. Hamu, the cute chef, turned out to be a great company. We enjoyed the food, the Dromedary dance he taught us, and company under the beautiful star ceiling. Nice trip and highly recommended!

Fantastic day to Atlas Mountains . What a fantastic jam packed day! We booked easily via Whatsapp two days prior to our day trip to the Atlas Mountains. We were picked up by Abdul (who was fantastic for the whole trip) in a nice people carrier and started our journey into the mountains. We stopped for Moroccan tea at the first house after this we carried on into the mountains stopping at the best places for pictures - the views are fantastic across the atlas and Abdul certainly knew the best places for pictures and was happy to take them for us. We had a short came ride which was Ok for the novelty factor, after this we carried on driving and eventually arrived at our next destination. We visited a small town in the mountains where we rode mules to a waterfall, hiked for a while and reached a Berber house where lunch had been prepared. We enjoyed the lovey tajine food and fresh bread basically on a roof top looking out over the mountain! The sights alone walking through the town/village were so interesting, to see how people live was great. We hiked back down the mountain after lunch and drove on to the lake area where we did quad biking for an hour. This was really good fun but perhaps could have been a little faster! Abdul was happy to chat to us and answer our questions but also let us snooze and just chill - it was a long day but so worth it! Great service and they even followed up with a whatsapp message the next day to ask if we enjoyed ourselves, where we thought they could improve and also if we needed any more advice or help for our stay. A truly great company - book with them you won't find a better trip that encompasses so many different activities and sights!

Amazing Sahara Tour with Morocco Active Adventures. We contacted Morocco Active Adventures via WhatsApp which made it easy to book our 4day trip, since they answered to my questions very quick. Our guide was great and amazing driver. We got lots of knowledge, passion about their Berber culture and fun and laughter too. It was a pleasure to visit Youssef's Berber family, enjoy lots of lovely music, try great food, see fantastic scenery, spend a great night in the Sahara desert under stars with Berber music.The food was very good as well. Excellent experience, strongly recommend!

As good as it gets!. We wanted a 3 days package from Fes to Marrakesh. When we were organizing the trip we didn't know which agency to book it through. The problem was that the reviews in many agencies looked to good to be true. We were sure that the reviews are fake but we were wrong. I cannot say how are the other agencies but the trip we did was perfect. Our guide was Said (excellent!!!) and he really overachieved our expectations. Definitely worth it!

Super experience of beautiful Marocco. After good, clear & timely communication per email upfront, we (group of 6 friends) were picked up early at our hotel in a comfortable airco-ed car (although maybe a little small for 6 adults) by our nice guide Abdul and then drove towards the Atlas. Fisrt stop was at a tradiotional Berber family house where we were showed around and tasted some bread and the lady of the house explained about the tea, then back on track towards a beautiful small valley for a short camel ride. Never did it before but what an experience :-) Then a longer drive through the beautiful & scenic Atlas and Ourika valley. The next stop was for a combined hike & mule ride (most of us liked it, myself I found the mules quite wobbly) to some waterfalls and a very tasty lunchbreak at a Berber family home. Then another spectaculair drive to the stop where we drove ourselves on a quad/buggy through the sand/dry river banks. After a long but very nice day Abdul brought us back at our hotel. He really could tell us a lot about moroccon,arabic & berber life and took good care for us by getting us new water bottles every now and then. Would definitely recommend it!

Amazing ATVing in sand dunes. You are left feeling that you want to do it all over again! We had a 4day trip including quad biking in Merzouga, the experience was great amazing. Our guide Mohamed was very friendly and expert. Highly recommended. Thank you so much!!!

Absolutely fantastic!. Youssef was the best guide we could have asked for. He met us at our hotel in Marrakesh and started explaining the entire trip to us while we were driving in a very comfortable SUV. He gave us history of every stop and he made stops that were absolutely unexpected (a baby camel and family!). Besides Youssef being fantastic, the trip overall was amazing. We spent time in the Atlas mountains on our way from Marrakesh to Fes. The stops were incredible including rock climbing in a gorge, a visit to a family friend living in a cave and a Nomadic family living in the desert. The ATV riding through the dunes of the desert was unreal and we could not have asked for a more fun trip.

A Great One-Day Trip with Kids. I must confess, I was nervous booking a trip over the Internet into the hills of Morocco with my entire family. We were travelling with myself, my wife, and our 2 children (10 and 13). We did the one day excursion into the Atlas Mountains, and it was a fabulous experience. We loved the 2 home visits and particularly enjoyed the mule ride up to the waterfalls. The trip was very professional and exceptionally well organized. The guide was thorough, knowledgeable, and even willing to tolerate us pestering him about his personal life as we tried to get some concept of what day today life is like in Morocco.

Absolutely Amazing !!. We (a family of 3 with a girl age 9) did a 6 days round trip from Marrakech to Essaouira, Safi, Casablanca, Rabat and Meknes. The route by the ocean is simply stunning. Our guide Abdul is superb and with his knowledge of the history and culture, he makes the tour a real pleasure. The accommodations arranged by Abdul were great and so were the places we stopped for lunches/dinners. This is the second time we did a long tour with Abdul as our guide, as in his company the tour is much more fun and informative. Can’t wait to come back again for another long tour to cover the north of Morocco.

Amazing adventure trip. We have just back from Morocco and we had a great trip with Morocco Active Adventures. Our guide was Mohamed and he is a very funny and friendly person. The was through High Atlas Mountains, camel ride, ATVs and hiking.

Fantastic four day tour!. Our tour guide was Said and he was amazing! We went on a four day tour around Morocco leaving from Marrakech, travelling south east. Our four days was jam packed with adventures from horse riding, camel riding (seriously uncomfortable), camping in the desert, sand boarding, quad biking and going to see the waterfall. Said was very informative, funny and kind. One of the highlights of our trips was visiting a Berber cave, it was truly eye opening getting to meet some beautiful people and see how they live. Our adventure was amazing, but it did require a lot of time driving, so if you want to spend less time in the car, just mention it to them when you are planning your trip and they will accommodate you.

Amazing Tour (3 days/2 nights). I dealt primarily with Mohamed in getting the tour setup and our tour guide was Hassan. Mohamed was very responsive and answered all my questions thoroughly before I made the decision to book the private tour. Tour: The tour was great and highly recommend it to anyone traveling to Morocco. We did the 3 day/2 night Sahara tour. We visited a bunch of places in between and spent one night in the desert. Hassan was friendly, courteous, knowledgeable, and very accommodating. Not only was he a great tour guide he is an amazing driver. Driving through the mountainous regions and tight roads was not easy and I came away very impressed and felt safe. Hassan was always on time and made sure we would be able to enjoy all the tours at a relaxing and enjoyable pace. Highly recommend the company to anyone on the fence about taking a private tour. For those who are considering group tours (the ones you can typically get at your riad or from guys on the street) be aware that those do not come with English speaking tour guides. You just have a driver bringing you from one destination to the next and a group of other tourists trying to figure out what things are.

Awesome adventure day!. I chose these guys based on other reviews. We took a private tour for 2 and we opted for a pre planned itinerary which started with breakfast in a Berber home, followed by a camel ride, a drive through the Atlas mountains, a hike to the waterfalls, a lunch in a Berber house, a donkey ride and then quad biking in the desert. It was a long day so be prepared, but it was so much fun! Our guides were very friendly and knowledgeable about Morocco and kept us very comfortable with bottled water and stops along the way. This definitely enhanced our trip to Morocco and I'd highly recommend it.

Awesome four-day customized tour. I have checked many many tours that start from Marrakech and finally found this one, it was the best I would say. The activities here were amazing. They were the most beautiful memories I have ever had. We also appreciated the customised service. We wanted to add Ouzoud waterfalls, which was on the opposite direction from our tour. But the company managed to do it for us. Our driver Saied and guide Addi were very thoughtful, flexible and friendly. Me and my boyfriend we had really comfortable time with them. We were worrying because many tours would bring you to shopping place, but this never happened to us. Every second we felt it was for us and we enjoyed it a lot. Lastly I want to see, Morocco was super nice. Especially with various activities. We did rock climbing, horse riding, camel riding, sand boarding, star gazing, quads biking... They were all super fun, I really wish could have a trip back there just do all those activities again. It was my first time doing quads biking on the Sahara dunes, we could drive to some areas you can never get access to with camel or walking. Saw those dunes without any foot prints. Wonderful!The accommodations were really good as well. First night we stay in a four star hotel on the way to the desert. It was kinda on the top of a hill. So we could oversee the town. The most amazing was the swimming pool, it had a cold water pool, a hot water pool, and while sitting in the swimming pool you can actually enjoy the amazing view. And the camp in the desert was the best camp I have ever seen. Very awesome and comfy. We moved our bed outside and slept under the stars. It was the first time we saw those stars that clear and the view was breathtaking.

Camel Ride. I know it is touristy however my daughter (16yrs) booked a camel ride at sunset. We were dressed in the traditional Touareg blue head scarves and dress and mounted our camels. Only my daughter and I were taken out with the most knowledgable young guide, whose name I forget. He told us all about the camels and pointed out many things of interest along our trek. He then took us to a Berber village where we dismounted and enjoyed mint tea and pancakes. We then headed back riding against the back drop of the setting sun. This was such a lovely experience to share with my daughter

Excellent and cannot be missed! 6 Star experience. Thank you to Ati and Sahid for such a great day - unforgettable!These guys are genuinely the best tour guides we've ever had in over 5 countries. They took care of us like we were their close friends and it was their top priority that we had a great time and learnt about Morocco and the Ber Ber people.We choose the Atlas Mountain one day tour and it follows very close to schedule but without being rushed or forced. The booking process is a bit strange in that you pay a deposit into a pay pal account but do not be concerned about this. Its a very well run business.Pros:- knowledgeable and friendly tour guides- well planned day with lots of activities (perfect if you are short on time)- everything is taken care of and tour price is all you payCons:- none We cannot wait to come back and do another tour.

Desert Delight (3-Day Marrakech to Fes Tour). Words cannot explain how amazing this experience was. Addi and Said are great guys who are very informative and friendly. For anyone wanting to really experience Morocco and Berber culture, such a trip is a must!

Wow! Exactly what we hoped for and more!. We had the most amazing time on our trip with Morocco Active adventures. Truly our guide (& new friend, Youssef) is what made the experience all worth it. He kept us laughing and seemed to know everything about everything. We could make changes in our itinerary for a "let's go look at that" kind of thing. Or he never once tried to hurry us even though we were trying to stay on schedule. Then when we were too tired and just wanted to go back to our hotel, like everything else, "No problem!" We slept out in the Zagora desert after riding to camp on Camels (pretty painful for the fellas). The camp was awesome but it was pretty warm (what do you expect) and the driving is very long. However you're going to leave feeling like you "know" Morocco when you're done. Youssef is welcome to our home in Las Vegas anytime!

Zagora desert 2 day. Booked from the UK and the communication was excellent and answered our many questions promptly. Booking and paying a relatively small deposit of 50 euros was simple through paypal. We then got picked up from our hotel at 9am by two really nice guys. The driver was a brilliant driver that drove at decent speeds but we always felt safe which is an achievement by itself as anyone has seen morrocan drivers would know. He told us that we of we wanted to stop for anything like drinks, toilet or just to take a picture he would (and did). The tour guide was really knowledge, interesting and funny. He told us stories of morrocan traditions, as well about the sights. For lunch we stopped in a lovely riad with a pool to cook off as the temp was about 43° at this point. Be aware that as they will stop whenever you ask the journey can increase. We didn't ask to stop that much as they advised enough places with spectacular views and sights. So with minimal stops that we requested it took us about 9hours to get to the desert. At the desert we were greated by the men from the camp that led us on camels for about an hour to a camp in the desert( while the sunset) . At the camp we were given green tea and time to shower, settle in etc. The showers were also pretty decent. The tents have a light, beds, a charging point carpets so you could say this was closer to glamping than camping ☺. Dinner was beautiful, tagines, salad and melon. It was quite windy when we were there so they didn't light a fire but they sang songs, played drums, guitar and danced. They kept us well entertained all night. Switching the lights off in camp gave a spectacular view to the unreal Blackett of stars where we lay until about 1.30. The heat in the tent was incredibly hot and many chose to sleep outside which seemed safe enough As it was very windy on our night we slept in the tent but it was very hot and nosy from the wind. We didn't sleep much but please don't be put off by this because it was worth one night of sleeping not too well. The next day, they woke us up ready to see sunrise, had another really jive breakfast before we rode the camels out if camp and started our journey back. Again we could of stopped in a a few museums but as I was tired I slept and wanted to just get back so our stops were limited. A truly outstanding tour, company and guides. There is so many more good things to say but my fingers are hurting any questions please let me know and il try and help

4 days desert, climbing, quad, Berber tent, camel and everything in between. Had a blast with Morocco Adventures. My guides Addi and Syed were fantastic. They were informative, knowledgable and truly amazing. I hope they get paid well and tipped well because they are worth every penny. Operator Mohamed answered all questions and was spot on with every adventure.I'm going to miss this place and my driver and guide Addi and Syed. We had some good times, ask them about the crazy Canadian.Thanks and will be backAdam from Toronto

highlight of our trip. An absolutely unforgettable unique experience. Our guide was brilliant he knew the culture and history of the whole country.All the hotels we stayed in had beautiful views and surroundings and really good food.We did loads of stuff the camel trek in the desert was definately one of our highlights.I cannot recommend this tour enough for a superb, authentic experience!

The absolute highlight of our trip to Morocco. We have just returned from a month overseas and I felt compelled to write about the amazing time we had with Morocco active adventures. Right from the outset, Joussef spent a lot of time going over the trip in detail and was very reassuring, considering we were booking at very short notice as we weren't sure of the conditions being suitable for a desert trip with two young boys aged 9 and 11 in July, until we got to Morocco. We felt far more comfortable and confident after speaking to him over any other groups we had spoken to.Abdul our driver was the best! Very friendly, easy going and accommodating. He took every effort to meet our specific, individualised needs - even to the extent that he sourced great places to stay with swimming pools in the most unlikely of locations, when my youngest wanted to have a swim after a hot day travelling! He also went out of his way to help us deal with a problem that occurred in the Riad that we had been staying at in Marrakesh. His service was not only above and beyond, but we had no doubt that it was from a genuine concern for us all having a good time. From Marrakesh to the overnight desert camp in the Sahara and back to Essouira over 4 days, we owe all the amazing things that we experienced to Abdul. We consider him a friend and were sad to say goodbye. I hope our paths cross again. It was a once in a life time journey. I have no hesitations in highly recommending this company, they are worth every penny - in return for a priceless experience.

Absolutely Amazing. I along with a group of friends went on a five day tour with guide Youseff and driver Mustaffa, and from the outset they both made us feel very welcome and at home. We went to many different cultural locations and engaged in activities such as rock climbing, quad biking and camel riding. Youseff was unbelievably kind and committed to the enjoyment of the group, and nothing was too much trouble. I would have no hesitation in recommending this tour to anybody that is interested in seeing Morocco for what it is, an absolutely lovely part of the world.

The BEST of Marrakech and Morocco!. We absolutely loved touring with Ali! He was so knowledgable and accommodating! I appreciated being picked up directly at our Riad and how easy all the logistics were! We saw so much of the High Atlas-a Berber home, rode camels, hiked, went horseback riding to a waterfall and even went on quad bikes! I cannot say enough good things! It was a great value and wonderful experience! This was especially great if you only have a couple days in the Marrakech area!
One day trip . They were Amazing!! Ali was So friendly and took some amazing pictures. Amazing scenery. Fantastic view into Moroccan culture. MMA WAS GREAT! Picked up very prompt from hotel too.

Best trip ever. My friend and I are college students studying in southern France. We both have been wanting to visit Morocco for some time now and we were unsure how to get to all the cool places we wanted to see safely and efficiently. Luckily, this company came in so clutch! First of all they completely personalized our trip to make the most of our limited time in Morocco. Youssef, our guide, picked us up and drove us the entire way. We had a 3 day trip that included a camel ride and camp out in the Sahara, a visit with a berber family, along with a bunch of other beautiful stops. Everything was beautiful and of all my traveling, Morocco was my favorite place by far. All of the accommodations were above and beyond expectations and our guide, Youssef, was absolutely fantastic. Youssef really knows his country and the people in it. Would recommend this company to anyone looking to make the most of their time in Morocco and get off the beaten tourist path.

Great day trip - highly recommend!. Our group of 4 friends recently booked onto the 'Atlas Mountain' day trip as we wanted to experience something a bit different and out of the city and this looked the most fun and value for money, especially with the great reviews. We certainly were not disappointed and loved every minute of this day-trip.Our tour guide (Ali) was really great and very friendly. Very happy to answer any questions on Morocco, religion, culture or just about anything. We went during Ramadan so considering his limitations he was brilliant.The itinerary they offer is a lot of fun - we especially enjoyed the walk to the waterfalls and the quad biking. There is a lot of driving involved but the views are amazing - especially all the changes in scenery and colours.Would highly recommend this to anyone. Even though Morocco is quite cheap and this might seem like high initial cost - you definitely get value for the whole day and see so much you would otherwise miss.Final comment goes to the organisation of the day trip. The website offers chat using whatsapp which made communication and organising very easy for us.Would definitely use this company again if we go back.

Best Tour in Morocco!. I recently completed a four day tour with Active Adventures and it was on of the best tours I have ever taken. I was traveling with my two daughters, ages 21 and 17, and we had Youssef Bani as a guide. He was absolutely wonderful. One of my daughters was ill on the first day, and he was patient and accommodating, allowing us to leave at 2 p.m. instead of 8 a.m. He took us to some amazing places that I don't think we would have seen on a different tour, and throughout the four days he was consistently professional, while also being very warm and friendly, throwing in extras such as midnight sand-boarding for my two girls who were up for more adventure than I was. Although we spent over a week in Morocco, the four days we spent on this tour were definitely the highlight of our trip. I would DEFINITELY recommend this trip, and especially Youssef, to anyone up for a fun, adventurous tour.

Highlights of Morocco, G Adventure Tours 14 days. This was not a "couples" trip but I had to click something. This tour with G Adventures was excellent in my view. We were 14 people in total. 4 couples late 50s/early 60s, six young folk...20s...We all clicked very well. Yassine, our guide, was a 29 year old Moroccan. Amazing ambassador for his country. This is an "adventure" tour so you are staying in interesting, quaint hotels. You are travelling in a comfortable van. We covered just over 3000 km. There were lots of stops along the way. There's free time and you are not obliged to eat or always be with the group. All breakfasts were included and about 4 lunches and 4 dinners. You experience local sights with local guides. We rode camels and camped one night in the desert. We walked up a mountain path and stayed overnight with a family, kind of like their version of a bed and breakfast. We had a fish fry over charcoal at a fishing port. Ate in the markets at the food stalls in Marrakech. I felt that that this trip was excellent value for the cost. We all enjoyed ourselves and we did not all know each other before hand. There was flexibility in what you did or did not do....but we mostly all always did all of what was offered. If you are looking for luxury and five stars....this is not your trip. But if you want a wonderful "experience", see how the country really is and get an education about this interesting country, try this G Adventures trip.

Best Tour Ever.! . Youssef is the best tour guide I have ever met. Me and my friends had a AWESOME trip in Morocco.! He was very professional and fun.! He explain very well and we stayed in the best places with the greatest views.! I recommend 100%.!

Awesome . I visited Marrakech in December and with two friends I enjoyed a day tour through the mountains and desert. We visited a Berber family where we drank tea, rode a Camel and did a donkey ride through the mountain, taking us to a family where we would had lunch. We finished the day after a beautiful ride to the desert through the mountains to have a mesmerizing squad ride during sunset. What gave our trip an extra was our great guide Youssef Bani, a very kind, knowledgeable young man who did everything to teach us about the culture and to make us feel welcome. We loved the music he played us in the car (a comfortable 4-wheel drive) as well :-)

An action packed tour with brilliant cultural features and wonderfully helpful staff. I went on a 5 day desert tour with 9 of my university friends and we had an absolute riot! From the moment we met our guide Yussef and driver Mustapha we felt very welcome and excited for all the activities we'd be doing. The rock climbing, hiking and quad biking had been arranged brilliantly and everything went very smoothly, even though we were a bit of a roudy bunch at times! The camel ride to the Berber camp in the desert was definitely a highlight of the trip and the stargazing there was spectacular. I would recommend this trip to anyone wishing to explore Morocco regardless of age or health. Thank you Morocco Active Adventures!!

Incredibly awesome trip!. We booked a three day desert trip with Yousseff. There was never a dull moment in during the trip. We learned so much about Berber culture. Since Youssef grew up in a Berber family himself, he took us to a a real family living in a cave, to have tea with them. The entire trip felt really "real" and was just flabbergasting! I can very highly recommend it!Some of the highlights were driving over the Atlas Mountains after it had snowed, climbing up a cave to meet with the Berber family, Yousseff willing to accomodate us when we said we were climbers (he tried to arrange a short climbing activity for us on the spot), amazing hotel on the way, sleeping in the desert!, riding camels etc etcJust book this trip, you won't regret it!

An enriching trip through Moroccan and Berber culture. Our experience with our guide Said was much more than being guided to the amazing sites and activities. Over 2 and a half days, we gained a much deeper understanding of the Moroccan people and their culture and the history and stories behind the places we went. We left as strangers but completed our tour as friends. The camel ride into the Sahara dessert was breathtaking, and nature delivered us a truly authentic experience with lots of wind and blowing sand. How we appreciated the Moroccan shesh (turban) that covered our heads and faces! Good food, a Moroccan drum performance with audience participation, comfortable beds in private tents, and yes...a flush toilet. The staff was friendly and funny and stopped often for photo opportunities. Don't miss it.

Met Gierende Banden!. We went on a 4 day trip with Mohamed and Youssef to the Merzouga desert and back to Marrakech with 4 persons.The first day they picked us up at the hotel precisely at 8 AM to start the tour. With our luggage on top of the car we left with "gierende banden!" in a very comfortable Toyota 4x4 to the High Atlas Mountains. Mo and Youssef where very good companions on our trip, although we didn't speak French and Youssefs English was limited. Mo could tell us a lot about Morocco which made the long car ride very interesting. Driving up the atlas gave us some amazing views. We continued the ride through the Dades Valley and the Valley of the Roses, too bad it wasn't the right season, for we did only see a few roses there. The day stopped at the Tinghir Valley, where we stayed in a small riad with a beautiful view over the valley. Here we had dinner and enjoyed a night with music played by the owner and staff.The second day we started with a visit to berbers in their cave to drink some tea. After that some rock climbing, a climb of about 20 meters, which was very nice to do and also very accessible for non experienced climbers. Then we continued our trip to the Merzouga desert. Arriving in our room we took only the necessary stuff with us to travel to our camp for the night, a one hour camel ride away. The ride was a very exciting experience, with beautiful sights of the desert. Beware of sore legs after haha! The next day we watched the sunrise, which was nice but not that special, since the sunrise was at the not desert side of the camp. It was possible to go sand boarding, we tried it, but since the boards where in bad condition and it was impossible to tighten your feet. You could only slide down and walk back up. The ride back was pretty good, and back in the riad we could wash all the sand away with a refreshing shower. Then, what I think, came one of the best things of the trip: Quad biking through the desert. After a short introduction by Mohamed (Another one, I think about 96% of the people is called Mohamed there) we went for a nice drive through the sand dunes. Mohamed really took the time to make everyone in the group feel comfortable with the quads and the dunes. We took some high dunes and steep rides down which were very cool to do. After the quad biking we drove to a big riad in Quarzazate with a swimming pool, pretty good.Last day we visited The Atlas Film studios and Ait Ben Haddou, an old town with lots of tourists. We also did some offroad with Youssef which was nice. Then we drove back over the Atlas Mountains to our hotel.We look back on an excellent trip and special thanks to Mohamed and Youssef! Who learned us to talk like berbers and make camel sounds, or was it the other way around? Thanks guys! Spartacus!

One of the greatest experiences of my life!. It has taken me far too long to sit down and write a review because I wanted to have the time to do this incredible company justice. I would book a trip with them again in a heartbeat! We did the day trip to the Atlas Mountains and our guide was so incredible. He stopped often so we could take photos, took us to have tea with a very kind Berber family, took us to lunch at a great restaurant, and was extremely helpful in assisting us up the mountain at our own pace. We captured great photos, talked to some great people, and had an incredible experience neither of us will ever forget. I am so glad we followed the advice of the reviews online and booked a trip with this company. I highly recommend them! Gorgeous scenery with the nicest guides around for a great price!

Excellent!. Morocco Active Adventures organized our entire tour – soup to nuts within Morocco. Mohamad worked closely with us for couple of weeks over phone/WhatsApp/email in the run-up to the trip to cover all of our requirements and build a customized trip. We are a family of 3 with a 5 yr old with some dietary constraints and demanding to see most of Morocco within 8 days.  After a relaxing flight in business class on latest acfts of Qatar Airways (SIN-DOH A350 and DOH-CMN on 787) we were warmly greeted by Abellatif Essaleh Amanar at Casablanca Airport. Abellatif was a very safe and courteous driver who looked after the tiniest of our needs. He ensured we had a safe vacation and didn’t miss any anything. He also doubled up as guide (although we had dedicated guides at all attractions) with his very good English, contextual knowledge is a walking encyclopedia – it was very helpful and appreciated. We must say he is indeed the best driver/guide we have experienced from all our visits around the world. An amateur music composer with compilations on youtube. He made the long drives seem very short with his songs, chat about Berber cultures, local experiences and education as we passed landmarks. We got very close to him during the 8 days. In fact, he even invited us to his place in Marrakech for dinner with family. We were amazed and privileged to experience such a warm Moroccan hospitality. We now have a friendship to cherish.  We highly recommend Morocco Active Adventures and Abellatif to all who is planning their next trip to Morocco. Excellent service.

Brilliant . The best few days ever! We went on 3 day tour Marrakesh-Merzouga- Marrakech beginning of April. Had an amazing trip filled with gorgeous views and amazing experiences all along. Our guide Hassan and driver Brahim were great. They are very knowledgable guys, all questions been answered with no language barrier. It was so easy to communicate with them and the office. I contacted them through Watsapp and received almost instant reply that just makes so much easier and way quicker then emails that i send inquiries to other companies that do those kinda trips. Don't look any further they do know how to take a good care and especially those two amazing people that we spent wonderful time with.I fell in love with Morocco it has so much to offer, landscapes are just amazing... I already booked 2 weeks down there. Cannot wait for next adventure in August to begin.Thank you guys for every single minute of the tour that was incredible.

WOW!. We booked this trip to celebrate our first wedding anniversary after reading reviews on tripadvisor, and so glad we did. This trip was without a doubt the best experience of my life. Hassan was out tour guide and what a knowledgeable, kind, honest , and funny man he was. There wasn't one question he couldn't answer and told us so much about the history and cultures in Morocco. The berber families who we shared breakfast and lunch with were also kind and friendly and seemed genuinely excited to share their life with us. We went on a camel ride, mule trek, walk to the waterfalls and quad biking to finish the day. Moubark our driver was also such a kind, honest and hilariously funny gent and made us feel safe the whole trip, even though driving on the crazy mountain roads. Learning about the culture, taking amazing pictures and eating some of the best home made food you'll ever taste made the trip amazing but sharing the day with Hassan and Moubark made the day so much more memorable and an experience we will never forget. We will definitely be back and next time for longer.

Unbelievable experience !!!!!. My wife booked this day trip for our 1st wedding anniversary and it was unbelievable and a lifetime experience . We were met outside our Riad by Hassan and taken to the tour car which was a 4x4 and then introduced to Moubark who was such a polite guy . We were then taken to a Berbers house and showed around and any questions we had were answered very clearly and explained very well . We had breakfast here and then made our way to experience the camel ride, we then went on to the atlas mountings where we were introduced to more Berbers where we travelled to a Berbers house for lunch by a mule . We then went to the waterfall and then sight seeing and finally to the quad bikes . I can't explain in words how amazing this was and how much we were looked after . Hassan and Moubark are amazing a lovely people and I would recommend anyone to try and get these to brilliant tour guides for there tour . We will definitely be returning soon for a further tour with Hassan and Moubark . THANKYOU once again you are both incredible people and such a great and organised company . It was the best anniversary with my wife ever and it was a pleasure for u both to be apart of making it that special . Such great and fun people . See you both very soon :)

Big day of fun. Clean, prompt transport with wonderful, engaging guides. Our day involved camel riding, visiting a but ur village, donkey ride, a hike to a spectacular waterfall and then quad biking for an hour.The breakfast and lunch provided were really tasty. Our guides were entertaining and accommodating.Can't fault it. Would recommend it to all age groups!

Unforgettable experience . Me (24) and my boyfriend (31) from london booked this trip because of the amazing reviews we saw on here and it really did deliver.We had the most incredible day and it was an experience of a lifetime. Ali was an amazing guide and makes it feel like you are all friends that have known eachother for years.You explore the Atlas mountains better than any other tour because there is very little driving and more exploring. We went to a Berber house for breakfast, then the ourkia valleys, then climbed the mountain, had a camel ride and a mule ride, lunch with a berber family and then we had the quad biking add on which is definitely worth it because you get an hour and a half extra in the desert!Do not go to Marrakesh without booking this trip, it was the highlight of our holiday!

Jam packed day!. We were met very promptly in the morning by our tour guides; Youssef and Mohammed. They were very cordial and pleasant. They took us for breakfast at a traditional Berber village; which was delicious. After that we went for a short dromedary ride. From there we went to another village where we mounted mules and navigated rocky terrain and loose gravel paths to another Berber village where we had a delicious tagine lunch with a very scenic view of the valley. We continued with the mule ride until we came to a very scenic waterfall, which was a lovely reprieve from the heat.FOLLOWING ALL THAT: we went for a quad-bike drive through the desert against the landscape and the sunset. In summary, it was a really busy day! We did so many things and travelled so far. Our tour guides were wonderful; made an effort to properly get to know us, engaged in lively and jocular conversation, despite an obvious language barrier, and were only too happy to accommodate our requests.5/7 would recommend to everyone.

Great Trip as a solo female. I am retired. I travel a lot. Solo. In groups. As a couple. I booked with Morocco Active Adventures to have a guide to introduce me to a new country and culture. They were great. Youssef was knowledgable, friendly and prompt. I felt totally secure. Whether in the Marrakech medina, on a camel in the desert or bouldering in a red rock canyon. He explained a lot to me about Moroccan history, Berber culture and daily life. I travel to expand my understanding and appreciation of people and places foreign to me. Morocco Active Adventures successfully provided that. I would absolutely book a trip with them again if I am so fortunate to return to Morocco.

Amazing day in the mountains. We chose this tour after reading the amazing reviews on trip advisor and we were not disappointed. We had only 2 1/2 days in Marrakech and this enabled us to do/see/experience so much in one day.Ali our guide was very proficient in English and gave us lots of useful information regarding Marrakech/Morocco and also offered answers to the lots of questions we had, if he didn't know the answer he found it out for us. He also very kindly supplied a huge bag of sweets for us to share with the local children on the way up the mountains, of whom we seen a lot. I felt bad when they ran out :-(My favourite part was chilling by the waterfalls and the sights and sounds we passed on the way there. If you have a weak stomach then possibly the mule ride may not be for you, it was a bit of a white knuckle experience in some parts lol....Best take proper shoes as we only had sandals which was not ideal and possible a little dangerous at times.Its a long trip so take plenty water for the day or small change to purchase.Thank you so much Moroccan Active adventure for our unforgettable once in a lifetime trip.

Amazing. I just wish I had time to do their other tours. I contacted Morocco Active Adventures before my trip via WhatsApp. They were extremely helpful in answering my questions as we have a 2 year old with us and I wanted reassurance the trip would be suitable with her. In the end we decided to do the Atlas tour but without the quad biking. I paid a deposit via PayPal and the driver came on the day we suggested (this was changed last minute from Saturday to Thursday as rain was predicted on Saturday. Thank God we managed to change the day).So Ali picked us up at 9am and off we went to the Atlas mountains. Started with amazing tour of a Berber house with breakfast. Then onto the camel rides followed by a mule ride into the mountains. Without doubt this was the highlight of the trip. The views were stunning. Breathtaking. Ali was busy taking amazing photos for me and I was on the mule with my daughter and my wife on another mule. The place where we had lunch was mind boggling. A different world. So relaxing. Views stunning.After lunch we took the mule back down the mountain and to Imlil where we started off. Then we went back to the hotel by 5:30pm.My only regret was not booking a longer holiday and going on their other tours. We hope to be back one day and I have to say, this company are brilliant.

Best trip of my life. I went with a group of friends and started out in Marrakech. Then we took about a 9 hour drive spanning over an afternoon and morning the next day. It was easily the most fun I've ever had on a vacation. We stopped for pictures along the way and stayed in a very nice hotel one night on the way to the desert. Last we rode camels and I've never had an experience like it. The tour guide was amazing and so was Morocco

Marrakesh-Fes. We took a three-day (more than 1000 km) trip with them from Marrakesh to Fes, via Merzouga. It went off without a hitch. It was a well-planned itinerary, great car and accommodation, and above all, extremely friendly, professional, and well-informed guide, driver, and support staff. Their prices may seem high compared to average prices in Morocco (for comparison, our 3-whole-days trip for 2 persons cost roughly the equivalent of 35 nice dinners for two in Morocco), but in my opinion, it was well worth it. Morocco is quite large and diverse, and if you want a hassle-free, comfortable and quite unique experience with no prior planning, I would highly recommend this.

Believe the hype - look no further. I have travelled the world and use Tripadvisor often, but never felt so passionately about an experience. MAA gave me one of the best single days of travel I have experienced anywhere. I contacted Youssef via Whatsapp and he arranged for me to spend an incredible day in and around the Atlas Mountains. My guide was exceptional and we went well off the beaten tourist trail. If you are like I was and browsing through seemingly endless companies for a Marrakech day excursion, look no further. A truly awesome experience. Thank you MAA.

Highlight of our trip to Marrakech!. We chose to do the Atlas Mountain day trip since we were only in Marrakech for 4 days and it was the best decision we made! Our tour guides, Adi and Abdul were absolutely incredible. It was only Adi's second week in training as a guide and he clearly is a natural. They were both so passionate about their culture and Morocco and told us story after story about the history, culture, their families, etc. Not only were all the activities spectacular, but we gained two friends along the way. I highly recommend them and I hope we are able to visit Morocco again and to do the 3 day desert tour with them. Highlights of the day other than our amazing guides: breakfast in Berber home (best semolina and tea we had all week), short camel ride on Aisha and Fatima, amazing views of the mountains, Mule ride through the village to the waterfall, short hike, delicious lunch of Tagine in a Berber home with view of the mountains, and one of the best ATV experiences we've had. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. -- Tell Adi and Abdul Harmony and Alex say Hi!

Wish we could rate them 7 stars. We booked with this company before we travelled to Morocco based on excellent tripadvisor reviews. The whole process of booking was smooth through WhatsApp. Their communication was very clear, direct and excellent with no hidden charges. The itinerary sent was self explanatory. We were a bit apprehensive to stay 4 days in a vehicle with an unknown driver but Ali (the driver) was the best person, we have met in our life. Very polite, genuine person with good command on English. He genuinely made us comfortable through out the 4 days long excursion. We had plenty of opportunities for photos, etc. The accommodation and food provided by the company was of high quality. The people we encountered at every stage were very nice and polite. Overall the experience was amazing. We got to see a different side of how people live in Morocco i.e. nomads and their way of life. Truly we never had such a lovely experience before. If you are in Rissani area, do not forget to have Mudfoona (Berber Pizza).

Atlas mountain/Berber house/camel ride/mule ride/quad biking. I booked the trip a few days prior to arriving in Marrakech.. I received quick replies. It was so easy to book. i just had to pay a deposit and the rest in cash.Our guide, Yousef was amazing we gave him the wrong address and he was so patient with us. He was on time to arrive and had water bottles ready for us, which was very kind. We drove to the Atlas mountains, visted the valleys such as Oukahmden, Ourika, Asni , Imlil and others, he parked the car at various destination we had a chance to take pictures and really enjoy the scenerey. His knowldge of the Berbers was fantastic and so was his English. We went to two Berber houses for breakfast and lunch. Which was organic,healthy and delicious. We learnt so much aBout the Berber way of life, the history and tradition. Yousef was such a lovely, humble person. I don't think we will ever forget him.He was really down to earth and we got on so well with him. We visited the Imllil Valley and hiked to the waterfall . The Mule ride was so exciting going up to the mountains. We also went on a camel ride. The quad biking was such a thrill, a must do! It was exciting to do it in Takerkoust llala lake. Amazing scenery, There was so much more but to much to write in this review. What i particularly liked was that we got to do everything in one day and i couldn't find any other company that offered this type of trip.Thank you so much Morocco Active Adventures, especially Yousef.Ahlam and Faris

One Packed Day of Great Fun (and Educational)!. The one day tour of the Atlas Mountains is a blast! Breakfast in a Berber village, camel ride, donkey ride, water falls, spectacular scenery, lunch in a Berber village, "lake" and quad rides to end the day! To compliment the activities we learned and appreciated the life style and cuisine of the Berber people. This is one tour where you will spend more time doing stuff than time spent in the vehicle. I would highly recommend this one day trip for anyone wishing to have fun, taste great food, and learn a little.

Cow Milk Zero (inside joke with our guide). We went through at least a dozen itineraries offered from the other operators, and this one had all the things we wanted to do and all in a one-day trip!We were picked up directly from our Riad and then taken in a very safe/reliable 4x4 SUV to the various locations/activities: tea/breakfast at a local Berber family-house, then camel-riding for 20 minutes (which is more than enough time for the novelty of it), then a more comfortable ride on a mule to a waterfall - which was pretty damn cool and which had a shack with locals providing freshly squeezed OJ, then mule-rode to a Berber house in the mountains and had lunch on the rooftop with a nice view of Atlas Mountains, then to a lake where people jet ski and stuff, and finally quad biking in the sand dunes/hills. The other tours have you riding a camel for waaaay too long (IMO) and either don't have the waterfall bit or the quad biking bit all combined into one day (we got back to Medina at 7pm).Ali was our guide and was excellent. He cracked jokes and went out of his way to make sure we were having a great time.Thanks!

A must do!. My boyfriend and I (ages 23 and 25) booked to do this trip to do on my birthday. Right from the start, Mohammed was great at corresponding with us, making sure everything was arranged before we got to Marrakech and giving us tips. We were picked up at 8.15 (Mohammed emailed to confirm the day before which I was impressed with) and went to a Berber house which was a great and insightful experience. I believe that no other trips do a few different villages! The mule ride was my highlight going up and down the mountain and to villages although at some points it was so steep and narrow I was fearing for my life a bit but that just added to the experience. The lunch was chicken kebabs, homemade bread and then a lamb tagine with potatoes and vegetables which was delicious and it was great that they had remembered my boyfriend is a vegetarian so he was provided with a vegetarian tagine which he said was the best veggie dish he has ever had! The trip is definitely worth the value and is pretty much a 11/12 hour day packed with different things and we basically had a private tour as it was just the two of us in a 4x4 with Yousef which was great. Definitely an experience we won't be forgetting and was a great day out of Marrakech. Would highly recommend!

"Brilliant 1 day tour and amazing guide. Best tour company by far. A week ago today I was experiencing a wonderful time on my one day tour to the atlas mountains. I wanted to do something memorable for my 40th Birthday and after much research on various tours in morocco I kept coming back to Morocco Active Adventures. If your looking for culture, tradition, history, fun activities, great food and warm friendly people, then this is the tour for you, this tour gives you the whole moroccan experience and a great time. This was the best experience i had in marrakech and far exceeded my expectations. It was a great tour with many things to do, see and experience and my guide youssef was fantastic!,he was very accommodating especially to my dietary needs, knowledgeable, informative, warm, friendly and patient. I felt extremely safe with youssef the whole day and he really made my trip one to remember ! Most definately an asset to Moroccan active adventures, keep up the good work Youssef.I booked my tour direct through email (morrocanactiveadventures@gmail.com) it was that quick and easy ! I booked my tour last Saturday, flew to Morroco on Sunday and was experiencing my tour first thing on the monday morning (my birthday !)I was picked up from my hotel promptly at 8.00am by my guide Youssef and drove about an hour to the Atlas Mountain through the Ourikka Valley. we stopped in a Berber village where we visited a Berber house to find out how Moroccan and Berber families live, and was a chance to share a local traditional Berber breakfast which allows you to have a taste of real pure homemade ingredients and made a lovely change from the taste of processed ingredients we are normally used to, made by the family, and to learn a bit about them and the history of the Berber people. After a short drive, we stopped to have a camel ride which i really enjoyed. We then drove through the beautiful mountain scenery with amazing colourful landscapes, crossing several authentic Berber villages until we reached the village Imlill via different rivers and Valleys such as Asni Valley. From here, we met with a local expert mountain guide and had a peaceful serene ride on a mule to another Berber house where we had traditionally made mint tea followed by a delicious lunch offered by the local family. After lunch, we went hiking/trekking to the waterfalls, which i found beautiful calming and peaceful. We then drive back on a different road to Marrakech, via Lala Takarkoust where i thoroughly enjoyed myself quad biking!I really enjoyed my trip to Morocco and my tour to the Atlas Mountain and hope to visit morocco again in the near future as i would love to experience the desert tour with Moroccan Active Adventures. This is a must do tour if you are visiting Morocco!! :) Shukraan to Mohammed and Shukraan so much youssef, hope to see you again.Salaam Alaikum

An amazing experience. I cannot fault this company. Our day trip to the Atlas Mountains was flawless from start to finish. Rashid was our guide while Ibrahim did the driving. Both were exceptional. There was nothing Rashid did not know, and he instantly made you feel at ease with him. Being a Berber himself, he knew things that other guides simply would not know. His fun, adventurous personality alongside his knowledge of Moroccan culture and history was staggering and we learnt so much from him. Ibrahim was, well, a good driver as well! It's not easy to navigate the small, dangerous roads which line the sides of mountains but he did it calmly and efficiently and never made us feel concerned. As for the trip itself - it was the highlight of our short stay in Marrakech. We soon learned that you had to go outside the city to experience 'real' Morocco and had we not done this, our opinion of the country would be unfathomably different. If you're considering booking an excursion while you're here, don't hesitate - just do it, and I can highly recommend this company - and I have pretty high standards.For our particular trip (Atlas Mountains day trip) we were picked up from the Riad at 08:00 and from there we had a 30min or so drive to a Berber house. We could look around and see how they made their food and lived, and then the Wife of the house made us Tea (which was gorgeous) and bread. We then drove further and had a short camel ride, after which a mule ride higher up into the mountains followed by a short trek. The mule ride was great - and was such an insight into how the Berber people lived. It is an exhilarating experience being atop a mule on such perilous pathways, going higher and higher (and then down, which is actually more scary) and putting your trust into the two mule-keeper guys who barely speak any English. But in fact they seriously know what they're doing because well, they do it every day. So don't be concerned. We then went on to a second Berber house to have some lunch and (you guessed it) more tea! The food was really good and the snow capped mountains in front of you were such an amazing view. Our guide gave us some typical Berber clothes to try on (something the other one didn't) which just serves to show how this company will go above and beyond to make your experience a little better.The day ended with an hour of quad biking. This was great and will most definitely cater well for any adrenaline junkies out there, myself included. The quads were in good condition, the tracks fun and enjoyable with some great sights along the way. We were dropped back to our Riad at about 7pm, just in time for a good picture of the sunset. Oh yes - they have no problem letting you stop for as many pictures as you want as you go up the mountains, so for all you snap-happy people, fear not. I would like to thank both Rashid and Ibrahim for being such spectacular guides. Both of you are lovely people - keep doing what you're doing. Maybe I'll see you another time.

A magical journey through Atlas Mountains and beyond to the Sahara. Just back from the most amazing trip to Morocco where we decided we wanted to see a little bit more than just Marrakesh. Therefore we booked a 4 day trek with moroccoactiveadventures and from the moment our guide Ali picked us us up from our Riad to the moment he dropped us back we had the adventure of a lilfetime.Driving through the Atlas mountains was simply breathtaking as was visiting Ben Haddou Kasbah, a world heritage site followed by the amazing Boumalen Dades famous by its Dades Gorges. Our first night we were blown away to stay in the most amazing 4 star hotel greeted in a tradional Berber way as we walked through the reception. Sat and watched the sunset with a cold Casablanca beer followed by a traditional Hammam massage (naked...who knew?) and wonderful buffet dinner with local red wine.The highlight of day 2 was reaching the Sahara and trekking across the Sahara desert by Camel for a few hours to reach a Berber camp where we met 4 other travellers and were treated to a Moroccan feast and Berber drums and singing and dancing. Such fun! At bedtime we were given a hot water bottle each and our own little Berber tent with double bed and heaps of blankets as it gets so very cold during the night. We lay on the dunes looking at the stars for quite a while....spectacular.... you almost touch them!I will never forget the sights and sounds of Morocco. The camels and goats on the roadside and dusty markets and souks that made you feel like you had been transported back to another age in time. Our 3rd night was in another wonderful Riad with so much charm and beauty. Our guide Ali was marvellous.....went far and beyond the call of duty. He was always smiling and helpful and went out of his way to ensure our trip was memorable. A really lovely guy...very traditional and humble. We miss him and can't wait to book another tour with this wonderful company. You literally contact them with what you'd ideally like to do and what your budget is and they put together a trek based on this. We were expecting to slum it at times but this was far from the truth....We felt like royalty. Thankyou Mohammed for organising our trip and to Ali for the magical journey you took us on and your friendship :)

Superb 3 day tour. Just back from a great 3 day trip with our guide, Ali. Very friendly, knowledgeable and a great driver too.Highlight had to be staying in the Berber camp overnight. A unique experience that I strongly recommend.

What A Day. We were staying in Marrakesh and after a day in the markets and souks we decided that the following day we needed to explore the Atlas Mountains a little. We were pushed for time as we were only in Morocco for three days so we booked this action packed one day tour and we were very glad we did. Our guide Youssef was fantastic, friendly, informative, good fun and really made us feel we had some basic understand of the culture of Morocco. The day was full of interest including camel riding, quad biking in the desert, mule riding a fantastic lunch in a Berber home and hiking to a waterfall. We enjoyed every minute as did our 13 year old daughter who was kept enthralled and occupied. When we re visit Marrakesh we will go for longer and book with this company again for a longer tour. The whole event was very professional and easy with Youssef picking us up promptly form the foyer of our Hotel at 8am.

What a wonderful trip to Sahara!!!. We just came back from a 4 day trip to Sahara (Merzouga) from Marrakech. It was an unforgettable and very exciting experience! I loved it. My favorite moments were entering Sahara on the camels, quad biking, and looking at the stars at night! I was amazed. Our guide was Youssef, and he was great. He is fun, patient, trustworthy and very knowledgeable, we learned so much about local culture! We joined another couple who turned out to be great companions, so it was 4 of us, which I think is the best way. Initially, I was considering 3 day tour, but I am happy we did 4 days because we had time for quad biking after the sunrise and got to see couple additional places, and weren't driving all day. While on the road, the scenery is constantly changing from mountains to dessert and it's so beautiful that the drive itself is enjoyable too. Youssef also considered our individual needs / desires and was very helpful throughout the trip. The company also provides additional bonus of free shuttle to or from the airport if they have available cars, so it was very nice of them to do that for us. I would definitely recommend Youssef and this company to anyone interested in adventures!!!! :)

One of the best trips I've done!. I would really want to recommend to travel with Morocco Active Adventures!Me and my boyfriend had a 4day-trip with Morocco Active Adventures, Marrakech<->Merzouga Desert, which for me was one of the best trips I've done!All events and parts of the trip held a high standard, which made us feel safe and comfortable the whole time. At the same time the trip contained unique experiences, surprises and adrenalin kicks.We had the opportunitity to do the trip together with two other girls, which made us a group of 5 people with the guide - This felt like a good group size and possible to fit in one car. Being a small group made it possible to be flexible and have personal requests about the itinerary.What really made our trip special and great was our guide (and new friend!) Youssef! While being both personal and professional, he taught us about the Moroccan and Berber history, answered all our thousands questions and made us experience a multifaceted and authentic Morocco.

Amazing Experience. I just got back from our 3 day 2 night excursion from Marrakech to Fez, with camel trek and night in the desert. I must say it was an unforgettable unique experience. Our guide was FANTASTIC, probably the best thing in the trip, he was a true berber who knew the culture and history of the whole country. Also, very important he was a very safe driver, which considering how much you travel should be a priority. His name is Ismeil and if you can ask for him. He went out of his way ordering Berber pizza which we wanted to try and setting us up for an authentic Moroccan barbeque. He also knew where to stop to take beautiful pictures. The hotel we stayed the first night was small and modest but we had a delightful host which served an amazing dinner. The views from his riad are also beautiful. The camel trek and desert were also a unique experience. The car used for the trip was very comfortable and well kept. It had bluetooth and a usb charger so feel free to bring your own playlist and also charge your devices. The one downside was the guide we hired in Ait Ben Hadou, this has nothing to do with the company, but i just wish he bad better english. Despite this I cannot recommend this tour company enough. Book your trip and enjoy, ask for Ismail for a superb, authentic experience!Greetings from Rio de Janeiro, Brasil.

BEST Atlas mountain Day excursion! Don't look anywhere else!!!. You really do not need to look anywhere else when finding an day trip to the Atlas Mountains which includes camel and mule rides PLUS quad biking!! Ali the amazing friendly tour guide picks you up from your hotel/riad at 8am then your magical trip begins. First you drive up to a traditional village house for some tea and bread/dates/fruits while there you can have a tour of the house, theres chickens, cows , lovely views at the top of the stairs also. Next stop is the camel ride! Short and sweet 20min camel ride with again lovely views of the mountains! Ali is always offering to take pictures and is very helpful! Then after an hour of driving (it does not seem that long when you are admiring the beautiful views, Ali always offers stop the car for us to take pictures. He also gives interesting facts and information about the Berber villages and towns). Once you reach the Berber village you are taken on an amazing mule ride it truly is an amazing feeling to be able to ride a mule plus looking at the most breathtaking views! You then take a short walk to the waterfalls (I personally found this waterfall better than the Ouzoud, it had clear water running down). After the waterfalls you can either go back on the mules or walk, we did both and the mules walk with us till the end of the atlas mountain part of the trip. Next was an amazing Moroccan lunch (best food we've had in Marrakech) in a Berber house with a panoramic view of the Atlas mountain, it was truly an amazing experience. Back in the car we go to the quad bikes but that's after we take a stop at another glorious view. That's it. So many activities in one day. Don't look anywhere else this is the best trip to the Atlas Mountains!!! Thank you once again Ali you were an incredible tour guide!!

Unforgettable tour fantastic tour guide. What a great trip. We booked the 3 day tour from Marrakech because of the great reviews and can honestly say we were not at all disappointed. Ali, our guide was brilliant. Everytime we stopped anywhere he knew people and wouldn't let us get hassled or pressured into buying anything! We had a slightly extended drive (due to terrible weather) to Boumaine du dades through the most wonderful countryside stopping along the route to eat and wonder round the Kasbar. We stayed in a hotel with the biggest beds I've ever seen and although the food wasn't great it didn't detract from the tour. The following day we drove to Merzouga for our camel ride into the sunset to stay in a Berber tent. Amazing. The camp was great, food fantastic and camp fire very necessary (it was very cold at night) and it even had a working toilet (not traditional I know but very welcome). Next morning we were up early for sunrise, back on our camels and back via more amazing scenery including the snow covered high Atlas Mountains, and finally back to Marrakech.Ali, our driver was truly wonderful, we felt very looked after. He is very knowledgeable and bought us, pizza from his home town of Rissani which we had for dinner after he dropped us back to our Riad. Also, and very importantly, the car was extremely comfortable which was very important as we spent a lot of time driving through the Maroccan countryside. thank you also to jousef for great communication before and after the tour. This is a great company. I really would highly recommend it.

Life changing experience. This tour is honestly the most AMAZING experience I have ever had. My friends and I had no idea what to expect, but because of our tour guides (Jose and Abdul), we had the experience of a lifetime. We were only in Morocco for 2 and a half days so this tour allowed us to do so much in one day: camel riding, atv riding, hiking the atlas mountains, mule riding, and having breakfast and lunch with a traditional berber family. Jose and Abdul were kind, funny, and so helpful throughout the whole day. They taught us so much about the culture and really went above and beyond to make sure we had a great day. Jose even was photographing each activity and he captured so many amazing photos. He also was able to connect with us through Facebook so getting the photos was easy as can be. Overall, I had the most incredible time and I already want to come back and do a longer tour with this company. Thank you so much to Jose, Abdul, and Morocco Active Adventures for an experience of a lifetime! I hope to be back soon.

Different experience . If you're looking for something different, I mean totally different, you HAVE TO choose this company!!! I might sound like a marketing staff from the tour company but I promise you in didn't get paid at all!!! LOL Imagine while other tourists are walking in the gorge you are already trying to climb up the rocky mountain for the very first time; while others are still immersed in the excitement of riding a camel, you have already hopped off the hump and jumped up and down various dunes in a 4 wheelers like in an 80s adventure movie set; while others travel for an hour just to visit a Berber family, you have a Berber guide by your side all day long, not to mention the chance to see Berber family in the Cave! All along with other stuff add up to an 4-day unforgettable experience for me and 2 other friends.Our guide Youssef is too good to be true. He's super considerate all the way, considerate like your family. Attractive and funny and a man with enough knowledge of his country and culture. Any questions you can shoot and you'll end up falling in love with this magical place without feeling like a total stranger. I think it's him that make Morocco, Berber culture and the whole trip so special. Also, his English is phenomenal which makes communication much easier and much more fun. I believe his French Spanish or Berber, now a bit of Chinese as well will contribute a lot to your trip. I'm usually a backpacker. But this trip is even better than backpacking. I know it sounds surreal but tell me how you would feel when Youssef turned a blizzard road closure into a breathtaking snow mountain siteseeing. And most importantly, Youssef is a very professional guide. Everything is arranged perfectly even with unexpected events and there's no unnecessary shopping and extra fees at all. I know it could be a bit daunting to try new things and price might not be cheap as those bus tours. But trust me, every penny you spend will be worth it. 我是16年2月来的摩洛哥，这个tour，特别是4天3晚上的这个带摩托，滑沙什么的是最棒的。如果看到这条信息的中国朋友不用找了，就报这个吧，真的特别赞。又可以攀岩又可以在沙漠里骑骆驼又可以在沙漠里骑着四驱车飞驰，我当时是骑着那个车飞上了一百多米高的沙丘，真的是永生难忘的体验。价格方面我当时也有犹豫，四天三晚不到四千的价格的确太贵，但是去完了之后真的是觉得太特么值得了。我们是三个人的团，可能会贵一点，如果你们有四个人的话，杀价杀到三千五百以下完全没问题。但是不要杀太狠，你玩完了以后就会发现他们家的利润真的是很低了。所以让这些可爱的Berber 人多赚点钱吧！他们公司的经营理念真的是很不一样，顾客服务更重要的那种。如果要找导游就找youssef，真是又可爱又性感的当地人。毕竟人家现在也会说一点儿中文，请放心大胆地调戏他。我实在受不了这么好的tour没中国人来过，必须安利

Great Tour, Thanks Ali!. We booked a three day tour from Marrakech, visiting the High Atlas, Ksar Aït Ben Haddou, the Todra Gorge, the wells near Erfoud, Ouarzazate, Valley Of The Roses, camel ride into the Sahara from Merzouga and more.Unfortunately for us, the tour was postponed by a day (due to heavy snowfall in the High Atlas pass!), but our guide Ali couldn't have been more helpful.Not only did he rearrange our tour, he also spoke to our riad to re-arrange our bookings, and kept us fully informed of what was going on.On the tour itself Ali was always happy to explain things to us, and really helped us get a feel for his beautiful country.The tour was a pleasure. If you're lucky enough to get Ali, ask him to help you find the local 'pizza' that's the speciality of Risanni - it's delicious.Thanks again...

AMAZING TOUR WITH AMAZING TOUR GUIDES. This was the best tour of my life. I had the most amazing time and we were able to do so much in just a day. My tour guides (Jose and Abdul) were amazing and planned everything perfectly. They were so polite and personable and taught my group and I so much about Morocco in such a short period of time. This trip was so great that I am already planning another one with the same company (hopefully same tour guides) for sometime in the future with my family. Thank you so much to Jose and Abdul for the great experience!!

Excellent trip with Youssef. The real adventurous trip with the right tour guide # I would definitely recommend you their thoughtful arrangements and exciting activities. I gave them 5 stars plus one for Youssef Barney. He is a real guide with professional instructions and considerate minds which make our trip full of joys. Au revoir ! Morocco! I will come back, for your company really gave us an unforgettable trip!

An Unforgettable Experience. I 100% recommend this tour to anyone going to Marrakech. There was a group of eight of us, and everyone was left in awe after this tour ended. Our tourguides Jose and Abdul were very friendly and were very knowledgable. It was very convenient (they were able to pick us up at our hostel) and worth every single pennyy. We were able to do so many incredible things in one day (camel rides, mule rides, hiking, atving and breakfast and lunch in a small village). I hope to come back and use the same company to explore even more of Morocco.

Amazing trip! A MUST DO in Marrakech, Morocco! A real taste of the culture!. We had a group of 8 and were only in Morocco for 2 days. We did the one day active tour through the Atlas Mountains with the camel ride, donkey ride, traditional Berber breakfast and lunch, as well as ATV riding. Honestly this experience exceeded any and all expectations we had. Jose and Abdul were amazing guides and they really made the experience for us. This tour was well worth the price and you won't regret it!! It was better than any other tours offered since they really show you the culture and life of the Berber people. A trip myself and my group will never forget. Thanks again Jose, Abdul, and Moroccan Active Adventures for the trip of a lifetime!

Snowy mountain day adventure!. We are two friends doing a short holiday to Morroco from the UK, we wanted to do a trip out of Marrakech for the day, and after reading the reviews for Morocco Active Adventures, decided to book their Atlas mountains day trip. We fitted in a traditional Berber breakfast and lunch, camel ride, short hike and quad biking in the desert and still got back to Marrakech not too late! we had a wonderful time with our excellent guide Youssef, who taught us some Berber phrases and played some good music in the car! We would highly recommend this trip, if we come back we would use this company again and maybe even book a longer trip.

2day dash over Atlas Mountains taster of Morocco. We were warned 2 days wasn't t enough by the team but we didn't have longer. Abdul was a great guide, we drove a comfortable spacious car hundreds of miles through the highest pass in Morocco in the amazing Atlas Mountains . We were disappointed not to see round the studios as we thought that was part of the trip but time was precious.the camel rides and the sunset in the Zagora desert was a treat. The Berber tents were luxurious and the drumming and singing into the night were great. Next day, our return was dashed by a huge dump of snow in the mountains, the first of the winter! This meant we had to divert round Agadir. Nothing was too much trouble for our guide and he found us a great eatery on the long journey.we would recommend books and in car entertainment as although the views were stunning and there was lots to talk about, you might find 13 hours of driving hard! Next time, we would use the same company and have a trip tailored to our needs. The company is amenable to anything. Not just the trips on the website!

Best part of our trip to Marroco. We can only recommend in booking a tour with Marocco Active Adventures. My GF and I had a private guide, that drove us from Marrakech to the Merzouga desert, where we rode camels, tried sand boarding, watched the sunset and the stars in the night and finally also slept there. The next two days, we also got to see very interesting stuff. For example, we had a tour in film studios, where game of thrones, Gladiator, the mummy etc. were filmed and we visited nommads living in caves in the mountains. The guide was very friendly and knew how to treat western folks, such that we had time on our own, but also gained some interesting insights, when he pointed out cultural and other Maroccan specific background information. Overall I would recommend to everyone interested in travelling to book a tour with those guys. One more thing: the contact before our tour was very easy, friendly and reliable. I could just write messages in WhatsApp and seconds later, I already got an answer.

The Road Less Travelled Trip- Marrakech to Fes *Amazing!!. We just returned from a 10 day adventure in Morocco and had the most amazing time! We spend the first 5 days with Ali, our wonderful guide from Morocco Active Adventures. Joussef was an excellent resource prior to our trip, finding the best itinerary for us. From the moment Ali picked us up from our Riad, we felt at ease and were able to sit back and enjoy the grand adventure. We stayed in great places, ate delicious food, helped nomads water their goats in the middle of the desert, heard amazing stories and music and felt a part of the Moroccan family.
