I cannot say enough good things about this company. Ali was open to all of our questions and always had a great attitude. We have the coolest pictures and many treasured memories from our time in the desert! Definitely would recommend to anyone!

Abdul is the best tour guide. I booked their package tour from Marrakech airport to Sahara desert(5day trip). My driver/guide was amazingly knowledgable about Morocco, Berber culture and made the whole experience quite relaxing and safe. The tour seems a bit expensive, but is well worth the money and If you are looking to experience real Morocco, look no further than this tour!

Day trip to Atlas Mountains. Just back from Marrakech for a short time and have great time in this amazing country. During our stay we had the contact with Joussef via whatsapp(during 10min) and booked a day trip to the Mountains with different activities including camel ride, donkeys, hiking and ATVs with great lunch in a Berber traditional house.
Excellent Day Tour. Brilliant day excursion with so many activities. Our guides (Yousef and Ani - hope I got the spelling correct!) were really nice with great senses of humour. Highly recommended.

Lifetime experience. This is the most fun I have had for a long time, it's a fantastic way to see the real country. Our tour guide was helpful, knowledgeable and fun. We really enjoyed it. Something different.

Awesome trip to Merzouga desert. We've had the MOST AMAZING experience in our life guided by Mohamed from Active Adventures.
The tour was for my birthday and we had great hike, amazing night in desert with a camel ride and the next day an active adventure with quad biking. Highly recommended!

Best family Sahara adventure. I want to recommend the 4day trip to Sahara to everyone coming to Morocco with kids. My experience with Morocco Active Adventures was just amazing! Safety is their priority, but fun is a close second! Beautiful landscape, good food, great service, funny tour guide. Highly recommend!
Desert quad experience. We did the quad bike activity with our three teenagers, totally fun and Excellent value for money. 100% satisfied.

Incredible experience all wrapped in one!. We took the 1-day tour out of Marrakech and it was incredible! My husband and I spent 3 days in Marrakech and this was the best day trip to experience what was outside the walls. Our driver met us in the lobby of our Riad at 8am and drove us about 30 minutes outside of the city where we had breakfast (tea and homemade bread with honey, butter and oil) with a local family. We got back in the car and stopped for a quick 15 minute camel ride (great photo opp). After that we had the option to ride a mule or hike to a nearby waterfall - my husband hiked wit the guide and I rode the mule. After the waterfall we rode mules to another local village and had lunch overlooking the town. View was amazing and the food was delicious. We drove for a while and then stopped to ride quads for an hour or so. The quad guide invited us to tea before going back to the car. Overall, it was an incredible to experience so much culture in one day. It was adventurous but not overwhelming; the guide really caters to each personality. No place we went felt like a tourist trap. Very authentic and I would highly recommend!!

Absolutely amazing!!!!. If you want to experience the real Morocco and do some soft adventures, this company is your place!! Our driver(guide) was very knowledgeable about the area we visited. The hike in Todra Gorges was wonderful with great views to reach the nomadic family in the cave. Our deseert overnight was the highlight of our trip in Morocco. Would highly recommend it for those looking for an adventure.

Morocco family adventure tour. We booked Morocco Active Adventures for a tour starting from Marrakech to Atlas Mountains and Sahara Desert. It was an adventure of a lifetime with different activities: Hiking in the Valleys, rock climbing in gorge and 4whelers in Sahara desert with a camel ride to the Berber camping. Our guide, did an excellent job and we really appreciated his insights on the historical context during the drive. We will recommend Morocco Active Adventures to anyone we know going to Morocco. Enjoy your trip!

A one in a lifetime experience!!. We did a four days three nights tour from Marrakech. It was absolutely amazing! Not only did we get engaged in the most romantic setting you can imagine (after a camel ride on top of a sanddune in the desert during sunset), but our guide Abdul made sure we had a one in a lifetime experience!He picked us up from our Riad in the morning and from the very first moment we liked his positive aura. He is very educated and talks very passionately about Morocco. It was such a pleasure listening to him, he taught us a lot about the Berber culture and all the places we visited. He was very caring, making sure we always had enough to drink in the car, or offered to stop the car for taking pictures or bathroom breaks. He always gave 110 percent, explained everything very well and we immediately felt like as if a friend was showing us around. Besides being the absolute best tour guide you can wish for, Abdul is also a gifted musician. He played the most beautiful songs for us while driving through this breathtaking scenery. Every time we listen to one of his songs now, we only need to close our eyes and we see all of those magical places again in our minds: the High Atlas, Kasbah Ait Ben Haddou,Kella Mgauna, Dades valley, Dades gorge, Tinerhit, Erfoud, Risani, Ouarzazate, Erg Chebbi, Alnif, Draa Valley etc... Probably the best part of the tour besides experiencing the width of this magnificent country was staying in a camp in the desert and sleeping in a Berber tent. The people in the camp were incredibly welcoming and went out of their way to celebrate our engagement with us. After dinner, they even surprised us with a song and a big cake with our names on it! Thank you guys, this memory will always be in our hearts and we promise that we will come back to the desert!Abdul and Joussef both made sure that we would get to the desert before the sunset and we want to thank you again for how wonderful you treated us! We felt very special! Abdul stayed with us for a while in the camp, he played different instruments with us and sang beautiful songs with his amazing voice, we simply loved it! Sleeping in the tents was super comfortable, they provided plenty of blankets, we didn't even need them all. We were surprised by the bathrooms in the camp, it made everything feel pretty luxurious. We would recommend anyone who is interested in learning more about the country and the rich culture of the Tamazight to book a tour and ask for Abdul (his English is great!). The booking process needs to be mentioned too. Joussef made everything very easy, he responded quickly via Whatsapp to our questions. They are real pros and we will definitely come back for another tour! We are so grateful for this experience and feel like we have found a true friend in Abdul.

Fantastic day out from Marrakech! A must do trip!. We visited Marrakech for a week in January and took a day trip to the Atlas Mountains with Morocco Active adventures. It was the highlight of our trip! We were picked up by Ali who was an extremely knowledgeable and helpful guide. The mountain areas were fascinating...so different from the bustle of Marrakech. Great scenery and really interesting seeing the Berber villages and houses. The lunch and mint tea stops were excellent.We just loved the donkey ride to the waterfall then up to the village. It was great fun. Finished with a very peaceful camel ride with no one else in sight, then upped the adrenaline with some quad biking. All great fun and definitely a must do trip! Thanks Ali!

Excellent tour . Highly recommend this operator. We were treated very well. Our guides were very nice and the experience was very authentic. The cost of the trip is completely justified. Great experience guaranteed.

Quality Tour. We booked a 3 days tour to the Sahara and spent NYE in a tent amidst huge sand dunes, which was an unforgettable experience. Thanks to our guide Ali who picked us up at our riad and who drove safely and explained everything in detail in perfect English it was an ace tour. He stopped wherever we wanted and we never felt anxious or uncomfortable, not even near the Algerian border. The camp in the desert was organised very well. We had a great vegetarian dinner there. We even had some tea at a nomad family's tent. After 2 and a half days our guide dropped us in Fes. It was definitely worth the money. If you prefer quality tours to cheap mass tours, this is the right tour provider!

Excellent Tour. We visited Marrakesh with a group of 10 for a view days. On one of these days we took a tour of the Atlas Mountains with Morocco Active Adventures.The tour was first class! The two tour guides were fantastic, the activities were amazing and the food was excellent! I would book another tour with these guys in a heartbeat. Absolutely class!

Superb. An amazing trip including camel ride, mule ride to a waterfall and quad biking. This was the highlight of our stay in Morocco! Picked up early by Ali our guide who was excellent! He stopped when ever we wanted to take a photo and was really informative on Moroccan culture. The highlight of the day was eating the freshly prepared food and drinking mint tea in the traditional Berber houses! The whole trip lasted around 10 hours. Comfy walking shoes a must!

Excellent day trip. We organised our Atlas Mountains day trip before our visit to Marrakech as we knew we would need a break from the intensity of the city. the great reviews on this site. Our driver Ali picked us up from our Riad on time, and we proceeded to the mountains. He was very knowledgeable with excellent English and a good sense of humour! He let us stop the car for any photo opportunities and also took some great photos of our adventures camel and mule riding, and quad biking. Breakfast and lunch in a traditional Berber village house was a great experience and the food was delicious, with awesome views! Definitely recommended, and worth the money, even if it may seem expensive to begin with. It was a shame we didn't have the time or money to do one of their other trips, but we definitely will if we ever return!

If you have a short trip to Marrakech, invest a day with these guys!. My group of 10 friends were in Marrakech for just 3 days but really wanted to see the Atlas Mountains so we decided to do the Active Atlas Mountain tour. It was an amazing, jam-packed day and every single one of us had a fantastic time. We felt like we saw all of the mountains by the end of the day, rode camels, went hiking, quad-biking through the desert at sunset, had gorgeous food and met some really lovely people. The mule ride was a surprising highlight for me as it was really peaceful! The tour guides Ani and Yussef really made it though, they were great fun and really knowledgeable, so much so that we'd all like to come back and do one of the longer tours! It was well worth the time and money and turned our Moroccan holiday from a good one to a great one.

Amazing Desert Trip. I had the most amazing holiday with Morocco Active Adventures during my stay in Marrakech. Our guides were very helpfull and knew everything we wanted to know. We saw all the major attractions and met great people on the trip. The contact were very easy(via WhatsApp) then a small deposit via PayPal.We will definately recommend Morocco Active Adevntures and will also come back to Morocco for sure.

Once in a lifetime, must-do experience!. My friends and I did the 4 day, 3 night tour from Marrakesh to Fes. This was a great way to experience the culture, meet some wonderful people, and enjoy the beauty of the Sahara Desert, in a cost-effective, stress-free manner. During the 4 days, we experienced a variety of activities and scenic views, as well as plenty of delicious food. The accommodations were comfortable, and everything just seemed to work out smoothly (such as arriving at the dunes at the perfect time for the sunset). Merzouga was a highlight of the tour, in the heart of the Sahara Desert. We had plenty of time to enjoy the dunes, and even took a camel ride to a campsite where we stayed in Berber tents and enjoyed traditional food, music, and breathtaking views of stars. Youssef B. was our guide and did an exceptional job. He made things very comfortable and safe. He was extremely knowledgeable about the culture and the different sites and experiences we had and it felt like he tailored the tour for us. He answered all of our questions and there was no question that we couldn't ask. We enjoyed laughing with him and learning about the culture. I will definitely recommend this to others and hope to make it back one day!

A must do in Marrekech!. After a couple of days in the souks this is such a welcome relief. This trip was amazing from start to finish. We did the Atlas mountains with lunch in a Berber village. Our guide was informative, funny and helpful and the scenery was fabulous. A real photo opportunity for anyone.

Great day with the locals. First I was amazed about how professional they are , our driver was outside our villa on time, They communicate with you earlier to confirm everything in advance.The tour start with local breakfast and small trip to the village. You will live a full day with local and experts the tour will show you how the real life goes on on Marrakesh and make you part of it.Bring a snickers shoes, The hiking road is kind smelly with all the donkey moving around but once you skip that awful tight road the open space is much cleaner and greater view. I highly recommend

Must do when visiting Marocco. This day trip was really the cherry on top of our Morocco cake! You get your own private driver, ours was Youssef and he was absolutely amazing. He knew everything about the Moroccan culture, landscape and people and was very friendly and fun. We laughed a lot that day! During the day you get to do different activities, such as donkey riding (my favourite!), camelriding, quad bike riding and you meet two different Berber families. And the drive through the Moroccan mountains and nature is absolutely a relief from the busy Marrakech. You get to see such a different side of Morocco, which is really amazing. Thanks Youssef for all your help, friendliness and laughter. This trip really made our Morocco trip!

Incredible!. My friend and I had the most amazing time on our week long Adventure tour, filled with non-stop smiling, laughter and fun. All correspondence prior to the trip was prompt and efficient and the tour was tailored to exactly what we wanted with no issue at all. Our host was great, extremely knowledgeable, adaptable, accommodating and just a load of fun. The tour is great value for money, worth absolutely every penny. Absolutely all elements of the tour were organised for us, a completely stress free trip for us! All accommodation we stayed in was far beyond our expectations and we most definitely never went hungry! As 2 young girls travelling alone our families had some concerns prior to the trip but not once did either of us feel even remotely unsafe. The experiences (like rock climbing, donkey and camel riding, quad biking, visiting a local family in their home a cave on the side of a cliff etc) were out of this world, things we'd never dreamed of doing! Would 110% recommend this tour group to anyone thinking about a trip to Morocco.

A must do when in Marrakech.... We did the 1 day Atlas mountain trip which was fantastic, well worth the money and was the highlight of our trip to Morocco, I would definitely recommend this .Looking forward to our next visit.

A wonderfully organised genuine experience - couldn't be bettered. As a maturish/ish active couple, we don't usually do 'organised' travel, but on a short three day break to Marrakech, we looked and saw Morocco Active Adventures and emailed/booked a full day trip to the Atlas mountains. The best decision ever!! Mohamed was brilliant with the pre and after email organisation, and our guide for the day, Abdul, was just amazing. Just us two, every single part of the day, the five different activities and people involved, were superb. Abdul was engaging, thoughtful and told us so much about the history of Morocco and the Berber people.We had a wonderful breakfast with a Berber family which felt like genuine hospitality, followed by a camel ride, a 3 hour mule trek up through several Berber mountain villages to a lunch with another family, onto a small trek to a waterfall, then back to the car and a drive back down from the mountains to an hours quad biking in the desert and a spectacular sunset. Every part of the 'team' really made sure we were enjoying our experience.... no expectation of tips. But my tip, would be to make sure you do have some cash on hand because we genuinely felt that Mohamed made sure to use small family groups to benefit both parties, a little extra for them ...... and a huge privilege for us. I wish I'd had a bit more cash, and I'd have loved to have had a few very little bits for the children we saw, happily playing with spinning tops. Absolutely not necessary nor expected....but we got so much from the day.We are already planning to go back to Morocco, to try another Morocco Active Adventure

What a tour!!!!!. What can i say?....AMAZING!!!!I booked All Trails Day Tour in advanced and liaised with the manager Joussef. From the first email i felt reassured and comfortable with thia company. Paid a small deposit to secure my booking via PayPal.My partner and I did a one day tour visiting the Atlas mountain and Berber Village, Quad biking, mule and camel rides. Had a fantastic tour guide and conversation kept flowing...this was one of the best excursion i have ever done. Most importantly, the highlight of my Marrakech trip.My advice to othera: do where comfortable hiking boots/walking shoes, bring wet wipes and a bottle of water. If you need something do not be afraid to ask the tour guide...they will make a pit stop etc.A big big big thank you to everyone at All Trails Tour. I will be booking through this company again when i visit other cities in Morocco.I highly recommend this company.

Wonderful trip with Morocco Active. Have just back from our trip from Marrakech and Sahara desert. We booked a day trip with Morocco Active Adventures to Atlas Mountains. The booking was very easy via WhatsApp with Mohamed, then we sent a deposit via Paypal. The trip to Atlas Mountains including different activities such as camel riding, mules, hiking, lunch with a Berber family then quad biking in rocky desert. Thank you so much for this amazing trip.

Family tour with Morocco Active Adventures. Our family had a highly enjoyable and informative tour with Mohamed as our guide. We were looking for an option for private tours rather than joining group tours that were offered through the travel agency I used to book the trip, and so glad that we made this decision! Our driver was great with very good English. If you are looking for something slightly different to your family tour then I definitely recommend you get hold of them for the Sahara Tour, you won't regret it!!

Great day tour. Just back from our trip in Morocco and Active Atlas Mountains was one of our highlight in Morocco. All Trails Tours was great, very easy to book the tour via email amd next day Mohamed picked up us at the hotel on time.Thanks again.

Amazing tour. Great morning out. Yusef was a great guide with the right balance of safety and adventure, friendly guide and very knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for fun, challenge, exhilaration and lots of laughter!!

A must do in Morocco. My sister and I had a four day desert trip including a full day desert quad biking tour and absolutely loved it. Mohamed was a great guide and the scenery was breathtaking. It will take alot to beat this quad biking safari. We definitely recommend Morocco Active Adventures for your safari in Morocco.

1 day tour with Ali. My husband and I booked a 1 day atlas mountain adventure tour with All Trails Day tours online from the USA prior to our trip to Marrakesh. We had friendly and easy contact arranging and paying for the tour with Youssef via email. On the day of our tour Ali our tour guide picked us up from our Riad and spent the whole day talking to us about the Moroccan way of life. We did the camel riding, quad bikes, mule ride to the waterfall but the most interesting part for us was learning about how the Beber people live and visiting homes for tea and lunch. Thank you to Ali for giving us such a great experience,

Amazing Tour with an Amazing Tour Guide. So we chose the 3 day private tour from Marakech to the far Desert and back. Day 1: Picked us up at hotel and drove through the mountains which were beuatiful, then visited a famous/awesome Kasbah where we had lunch. Then continued through the country stopping a few times and then arrived at our hotel for the night. Day 2: Left hotel in morning and then visited an awesome Gorge, Oasis, and town. Absolutly stunning scenery. Also had the opporutunity to visit a nomad family who lived in the mountain side (amazing experience), then continued on visiting ancient desert water wells and a fossil processing plant. Lastly dropped off at the edge of the true desert for the camel ride. This was the highlight of the trip and was surreal. Camped overnight in the desert and looked at the stars for hours among the dunes after a great dinner and music. Day 3: Left on the camels right at Sunrise and got back to hotel, then a lot of driving back to Marrakech. Overall a near perfect Moroccan adventure among out of this world/time scenery. One of the most important aspects of this was our tour guide. He made the vacation/tour unforgettable instead of merely great. Was extremely intelligent, spoke English well, passionate about his country/culture, and was really friendly. Helpful in every way. If you are an English speaker make sure you request Abdul!

A life changing experience!. We took the all day tour to the Atlas Mountains. This was an amazing experience. The entire day was filled with exiting things to do and see. But the best part of the tour was getting to know great people and a new culture. We were welcomed in the home of 2 Berber families for lunch and tea. We had a wonderful time with our guide, Ali. After the tour is over, you will look back and remember this day as one of the best experiences in your life!

Loved every minute!. Took the 3 day tour, Marrakech - Merzouga/Erg Chebbi - Marrakech. Youssef picked us up from our hotel, and showed the time of our lives! He is an amazing driver and an awesome tour guide. I hope you like off roading and going off the beaten path. We started our trip off seeing the mountains, the gorge was spectacular and met a family of nomads that lived in a cave. They invited us to their home and we all had tea. Everyone we came across was friendly and welcoming, I learned so much about Morrocco and the culture. You'll be eating real Moroccan food, it's yummy! If you're looking for a unique adventure this is it. I highly recommend it. The food and accommodations were amazing, stayed at the Xaluca dades hotel we received a royal welcome of singing at the entrance. Not expected at all! Driving through the desert was amazing but the camel ride was into the desert was the best! After the camel ride you enter a camp site in the middle of what appeared to be nowhere. Don't worry, there is a washroom. We shared the camp site, with a small group of tourists. The stars at night were stunning. The Berber music really set tone for the evening. You'll be able to see some animals, mostly cats, I saw a bat and mouse prints in the sand. Best trip of all time! I would go back in a heart beat. Thank you Youssef!

An Amazing Experience. We had an amazing tour of Morocco. We chose the four day desert tour, and everything went smoothly, from booking to being picked up at our riad in Marrakech. Our guide was Youssef, who was amazing. He had many interesting stories to tell us about the culture of Morocco. Highlights were Todgha Gorge, and the sand dunes at Merzouga, which we crossed by camels and camped at overnight. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Morocco.

Adventure atlas mountain trip. We had an amazing day with our guide Hassan and driver Mohammed. They picked us up from the hotel and took us out first for a camel ride, then we went to a local house for tea and breakfast. I am a beginner photographer and Hassan knew all the best spots for photos and took plenty of pictures of us too. Then up to the mountains on the mules which was my favourite part of the trip. We finished the day with quad biking. I would recommend this trip to anyone, it was real value for money, Hassan was friendly and knowledgable. We felt safe in Mohammed's hands, he even had to tackle a rock slide. Communication was wash via whatsapp. If we return to Morocco we will definitely be booking another excursion.

Day trip to Atlas Mountains, with Camels, mules and quad bikes. We are six middle age friends from Surrey. We booked the one day Atlas mountain tour and had a fantastic day.Ali our driver was excellent, from camel rides, to mules up to the waterfall and lunch with a Berber family and afternoon evening creating sand storms driving quad bikes across the desert. All of it was excellent.Thanks Ali and thank you All Trails Tours
Brilliant. I had the most fun on this trip. Singing in the dessert and drinking mint tea! It was a really relaxing day and good to do something different.

2 Day Tour in Atlas Mountains. I searched a lot of different tour operators before choosing this company and I am so glad I did. All the reviews so far are spot on, you can't go wrong booking with these! I traveled to Marrakesh with 3 other girls (in our 30's) for a week in Sept and we wanted to experience more than just the city life, but we only had a couple of days to spare.Morrocco Active Adventures came up with the perfect package for us, ticking all the boxes....camel ride, hiking, waterfalls, experiencing Berber culture and quad biking spread over 2 days.Our wonderful guide Abdul picked us up at our hotel on time, in a comfortable jeep to start our adventure! Abdul entertained us while we made our way to the Atlas Mountains. He gave us really good insight to Berber culture and Morocco in general, it was really interesting! We were able to have a laugh with him too, which added to the overall experience.We stopped to do the Camel ride first, which was good fun. It was the first time for me so it was a novelty and the guide that took us up the track was really friendly. You can take pictures as you please and you don't feel under pressure to tip.Abdul then took us on to our next stop which was a traditional Berber family home. We were shown around the house met the family, they were so nice. The grandmother showed us how to make a proper sweet mint tea and gave us freshly baked bread with local preserves etc. I also got some Henna done by the young girl in the family. All the time Abdul was translating from Berber to English and we were able to interact with the family. It was a really humble experience. The Atlas Mountains are beautiful, especially in the valleys. We arrived in a village, where we went on a short hike to some waterfalls. Our guide was really sound, he didn't rush us, we could stop and take photos and rest when we needed to. It was really enjoyable.Abdul then met us again and drove us to the next village we would stay for the night. We got our evening meal in another traditional Berber house, in the middle of the mountains where we saw the sunset and had a gorgeous lamb tagine cooked by the family. It was so tasty! We learned some Berber words! That night we stayed in a small hostel down the road, pretty basic. 1 room with 4 single beds, shower facilities. It did the job, don't expect luxury! :) We had fresh pancakes and mint tea in the morning before we set off to do our 4hour hike around the mountains. Our guide was a young local Berber lad, who knew the area very well. His English wasn't amazing, but he got his message across. It was a nice temperature for hiking, not too hot. The scenery is beautiful, very diverse and hard to believe the dessert is only a few hours away!We arrived at another village where we got our lunch served at a local restaurant along the river. Don't expect amazing food here....it's in the middle of the mountains! Before we set off we got a mule ride through the village in these narrow streets, it was a lot of fun! The locals were so nice and welcoming. Our last stop was the quad biking, it was brilliant! Great track where got to let rip but they were still very safety conscience. They took pictures in the middle of it. You will get dirty.....as it is all sand and dust, but I would recommend it if you like a bit of speed!We got dropped back to our hotel that evening after a fantastic adventure! I would highly recommend this tour company to anyone! It was extremely good value for everything we got and I couldn't say more positive things about our guide Abdul!

THE option if you're visiting Marrakesh and the desert. My wife and I went from México to Marrakesh in September 2015 and hire "All Trail day Tours". At the beginning we weren't very sure about our choice because there are many agencies offering similar services, however it worth every Euro, believe me. We hire the private tour from Marrakesh to the Merzouga desert, our driver Mohammed made the trip really interesting and fun. It was very valuable that Mohammed was completely flexible to stop every time we wanted for a picture or to rest and go to the bathroom. The restaurants and hotels along the trip are very good options because you don't miss a typical meal or you get to stay in beautiful Riads without compromising your comfort or safety. The all wheel drive van was confortable and had all the equipment to enjoy the trip AC, seat belts, nice seats, etc. While in the road we had the opportunity to visit the "Atlas" film studios,Todra Gorges, Dades Valley, some local markets and obviously the Merzouga desert experience and camping was amazing! When we got back to Marrakesh the company provide us a local guide called Aziza which was very friendly and knew a lot about the surroundings. Definitely a very good experience I recommend and would take again if possible.
camel rides. this is a very fun way to get into nature with the family and also be with animals that are friendly and able to get you where you need to go safely

Some of the best three days of my travelling adventures so far!. We - two girls in our mid twenties - spent three days with Youssef (tourguide and driver). From the minute Youssef picked us up from our Riad we had a great time. There's a lot of driving involved, especially as we asked to head back to Marrakech rather than Fez - but the sights along the way, the continuous information from Youssef and the stops for photos were just amazing. My favourite night was the first night in the budget Riad (very authentic and bit like staying at your Moroccan grandparent's house - very homely, warm and colourfully decorated). The view across the valley was just indescribable - it certainly didn't seem like a cheaper option. My friend's highlight was the following night in the desert. We rode camels in, had a go at sand boarding and then literally slept under the stars, before quad biking across the dunes the following morning. It appeared Youssef purposefully avoided tourist spots where possible, we asked to eat lunch in authentic places so that's where he took us and it seemed like we got to see some of the real Morocco. Three days together could push anyone's limits but the three of us didn't stop laughing and Youssef felt like a good friend rather than a tour guide. We were initially concerned about the price, but honestly, it was worth every penny. It's a lot to do/travel in 3 days which was fine for us but probably a bit too much for young kids so I would say do it over a longer time period.The only thing that could have made it any better would have been setting off on the camels maybe a bit earlier so we could have got more sandboarding in before dark.If you do anything in Morocco, do this tour! We have holiday blues from this excursion alone.

Great day tour. Having a short time in Marrakech, we took a day tour in the Atlas mountains. Our guide and driver were so friendly all day by giving us water and taking photos. We ride camels, mules and did an hour of quad, in the middle of the real Morocco. A must do for people that wants to discover outside of the city

Amazing one-day desert adventure!!. We chose the two-day one-night trip to Zagoura desert. The desert adventure is a great experience, very interesting and well organized. Youseff is a great guide, cordial, talkative and very knowledgeable. The camp site was comfortable and had all the necessary amenities such as shower, toilets, and wonderful food. In the morning we were woken up early to enjoy the beautiful sunrise, which was lovely. If you don't have too much time, but want to enjoy a break from Marrakech, this is a very good choice!

An incredible day in the mountains, Suhkran!!. All Trains Tours definitely deserves five stars! This was our first time in Marocco and we decided to do the day excursion to Atlas Mountains to get away from the hectic life of Marrakech. We never expected to see and do so much in just one day; ride camels and mules, visit traditional Berber houses to drink tea and have lunch, hiking to a waterfall and a ride on a quad bike. There is something to enjoy for everybody!We were lucky to be one of the very few tourists that day, which gave us the opportunity to get a great impression of how the Berbers live in the mountains. Not to mention the detailed an abundant information of our incredible guide, Joussef, who definitely took part in making this trip unforgettable. He clearly enjoyed teaching us more about his country and traditions, and he took the time to answer all our questions.This day was undoubtedly the highlight of our vacation, and was worth every euro we paid. On our next trip to Marocco; another great excursion and the same guide please!
Best Trip! Must do while in Marrakech. This day tour was amazing. Hassan and Ali were the best. Everything you could possibly want to do was done on this tour. Also best food on my trip
Great camel trek up the Atlas mountains. We went on a day trip which included a camel trek up the Atlas mountains, great guide and a real fun day out!

Memorable Experience with All Trails Day Tours. I found it quite overbearing the amount of tour companies on offer both on TripAdvisor and in Marrakech. I wanted to organise a day trip for my mum and I, quickly and without any fuss or bargaining involved. I came across All Trail Tours online and found a whatsapp contact for Youssef. Within 15 minutes of sending a message I was able to organise a personalised and private tour that suited both my mum and I, for the NEXT day. It was such a wonderful and memorable experience and we had a fantastic and knowledgeable and kind tour guide accompanied with a very safe driver who gave us a day to remember in and around the Atlas Mountains. Without a doubt, I would highly recommend booking a trip through All Trails!

Beautiful experience. Booked a 3 day trip through the riad where we stayed first night in Marrakesh.
Unforgottable experiance. Travelling through the Atlas Mountains, ending up in Sahara was one of the most beautiful experiences.
Sleeping in the tentunder the clear sky in Sahar is just breathtaking!never will forget this trip.

Amazing!!!. I went with 2 other friends and we had a amazing time. I would recommend Youseff he was brilliant in every way possible he was very accomadating and helpful and gave us the best time we could have had. The trip was so much more enjoyable when you know you can communicate well with Youseff and he made us laugh through out our trip. We will never forget marrakkesh and we will never forget Youseff he was the best!!!!!

AMAZING TIME!!! Best tour guide in Marrakech!!. We went as 3 girls, so we wanted adventure, we were up for anything lol our tour guide was yousaf, he understood us all, and knew exactly what we wanted to do, he organised 2 days for us, and we couldn't have done it better ourselves!! we all REALLY enjoyed the activities, especially the camal ride! Yousaf was an amazing tour guide, he understood all our needs, he never rushed us, and gave us enough time to do things in our own time, his car was fully air conditioned, and he always stopped for our cigarette breaks lol there was no problem with English because he spoke it fluently. Thank you yousaf for an amazing and unforgettable time in Marrakech!!!! We couldn't have done it without you!!!!!

3 day trip to Merzouga. On the first week of august-2015, I book a 3 day trip to Merzouga; before the booking, the Travel agency was dedicated to attend all of my questions and not-very usual requests (i.e. to do the 3 day trip in 2.5 days, with pick up and drop off at the airport). The driver, who also was my guide, Mr Youssef Bani was simply great; he spokes 5 o 6 languages fluently, excellent driver and most important, friendly and respectful; I strongly recommend both the agency and the guide, they are very helpful and will take good care of all your travel needs, from finding a good place to eat, buy, sightseeing, etc..

Just Perfect. It was absolutely amazing from start to finish and the staff were very friendly.We spent 5days in tour including 2day quad bikes driving from amazing ocean of sand dunes to a Oasis. We went off road which was a dusty, adrenalin pumping experience and ended up in our hotel in Merzouga village. In my opinion it's the best way to see some amazing sights even with very short time. Will definitely return when we next go to Morocco with more time!! Overall, would recommend for a fun trip!

Great day with a few problems. We have given this a 3 star as although we had a great day there were definitely a few problems.Pick up was on time and a good, new, comfortable car, the driver/guide (don't know if he was a guide or not) was good and very friendly.When we got to the waterfalls however he just pointed at a path and said follow that down to the waterfall, we followed this path which stopped and you had to go down the hill with no clear paths. We got lost for over an hour in the 40 degrees heat which was obviously not ideal, other people were with guides on their separate tours (they all weren't heading to the waterfall so we couldn't follow one) and it was hard for them to direct through these woods we were heading through. We eventually turned around and made it back to the start point and then headed down the hill on the other way "the exit" route from the waterfalls down the steps and past the shops.We eventually made it down and found our driver/(guide?) at the bottom waiting for us. We were not happy at this point however he redeemed the day by paying for our boat trip under the waterfall and also by reserving us, in or opinion, the best seat in the best cafe for our lunch.The waterfall was a great thing to say however it was Moroccan school holidays and it was full of kids jumping in the water which rendered the water a horrible brown colour at the bottom, we know from a family members previous trip that at different times of the year the water was very clear and attractive. This is not the tour operators fault though of course. We would have scored this a 5 had we not just been pointed in a direction and sent off on our own. This was not acceptable in our opinion.

Astounding tour with incredible people. As two young women traveling alone, we took a lot of care selecting a tour company and are so glad we settled on MAA. Our guide, Youssef (also known as José) was out of this world. We felt not just cared for but like we were truly friends. Our four-day, three-night tour took us through Dades Valley, Merzouga, the Sahara, and Ouzazarte. We were picked up from and delivered back to our Riad in Marrakech. We got to ride camels, have tons of tea with locals, go on an exciting hike through the gorge, chat with Berbers and learn some of the language, play with a ton of adorable babies (Youssef is the world's best baby playmate), get henna in a local home, and, of course, ride camels and watch sunrise and sunset over the sand dunes. But more important than all of these "active adventures" (harhar) was the sense of the "authentic" Morocco, which we got from visiting donkey parking, eating local dates, and most of all, talking with Youssef. He is a fount of information and is so passionate about his country and people. This sense of cultural exchange was exactly what we were looking for but hard to find in reviews - so if this is what you're seeking, a real dive into what Morocco means to Morrocans, then MAA is the place for you.The entire team went above and beyond in terms of caring for us. Some of the examples I won't even say because others should not expect them - we certainly didn't - but, for example, they helped out tremendously when we were having bank problems, catered generously and attentively to a gluten intolerance, and generally went above and beyond to make us feel safe and cared for. This adventure is what made Morocco and the whole trip for my friend and me. We would do it again a hundred times, and encourage you to do so! It's outstanding and worth it.

excellence. My husband and I returned from Morrocco changed people the care and fastidious attention to our needs could not have been more perfect. Our guide was incredibly knowledgable. He had an amazing sense of our travel and life experience and matched it perfectly when we asked him advice about what to do and see while in Marrakkech. I cant say enough about how perfect this trip was thanks to this travel company.

Great Camel Ride, beautiful trip in Marrackek. Our 3 days tour with Ali was at the right choice. He was a very gentile and intelligent guide and processes some of the best skills to be a tour guide.The tour is not cheap but has good value. We enjoyed time riding the camels, traveling to the other side of the area, learning about local food and some interesting culture.We love the stories from Ali.Thank you all for arranging such a good trip.

Amazing guided experience!. Since there were only 3 of us, we were very careful when choosing a tour guide for our first trip to Morocco. A friend recommended us Morocco Active Adventures, and, honestly, it was the best decision we made. Our tour guide was Joussef, and you could see he loves what he does; he was very kind and respectful. Throughout the trip he became our friend; for that, we are truly thankful. It was an amazing trip; the hotels where we stayed were beautiful, and the people who worked there were very amicable and provided a magnificent service. The night at the desert camp was unforgettable and the camel rides at sunset and sunrise indescribable. Joussef is fluent in five languages, including Spanish and English, which was a big plus for us. We recommend Morocco Active Adventures to everyone, it is worth the money and it leaves you wanting to go back.Morocco is a beautiful country!Thank you again for everything Joussef,Alexandra, Jose and Estefania

“amazing country with a wonderful guide/driver”. We Just came back from a great trip arranged by Morocco Active Adventures. From Marrakech to Fes via Erg Chebbi sand dunes, the landscapes are just amazing, Valleysm forests, mountains then sahara desert and we were welcomed by our camels in Merzouga desert. Our guide Jose is one of the best person we had in Morocco, he is very funny, friendly and knowledgeable driver guide.

Excellent off the beaten path guided tour. Abdul was our guide for the day and arrived a bit late to pick us up at the hotel, mighty apologetic for the delay because he went to the wrong hotel by accident. Anyway, he was there and we got into his car for a fabulous, adventurous journey. Abdul is personable and an excellent guide. He took us to traditional Berber homes in the Atlas mountains for breakfast and lunch and is a treasure trove of history, pop culture, philosophy, religion and anything else you may be interested in about the local area. Since we come from a place famous for skiing, we wanted to see the ski resort in the Atlas mountains. This meant a detour for Abdul from the planned route, but he did it cheerfully. There was some snow there in May which excited the children. On the way back to the hotel, we also hired quad bikes for a trip through some rugged terrain. Once again, enjoyed by the family. By the end of the day, my boys got quite attached to Abdul and were sad that the trip had come to an end. I think that is a great testament to what a superb tour it was. I would definitely recommend Morocco Active Adventures for any type of tour. There is a good reason they have nearly 100 5 star reviews. They have earned every single one of them.

Visit to Marrakech. The best tour in the world! Worth the money. 100% recommend. You will love Marrakech!! Camel ride, camping at dessert, beautiful views. The tour guide will become your friend. Everything is awesome.

Incredible tour...definitely recommend!!. Best tour experience we could have asked for. Jose was an incredible guide and became a friend, going above and beyond the job requirements to make sure we had the best experience possible. He made the car rides fun and the accommodations both nights were incredible. This tour made me want to return to Morocco and I have already recommended this tour to many friends!! Thanks for the experience of a lifetime!!!!!!!!!

Jose is the BEST!. Jose was the best tour guide we could have asked for. Not only did he do an amazing job during the tour, but he also made sure to take care of us after the tour was over. He took us to the airport during his free time, and even made a stop at McDonalds! We hope to remain good friends with him. As for the actual tour, it was UNBELIEVABLE! The long car rides were so much fun, as Jose made sure to make it interesting along the way. We stayed in a beautiful hotel the first night and then in tents in the Sahara the second night...the tents are more like hotel rooms! Jose and the other tour guides that were in the desert with us even made a cake for one of us who had a birthday that day. Needless to say, Jose and Morocco Active Adventures are definitely the best!

Amazing Morocco. This tour exceded all of my expectations. The sights were spectacular and the hotels we stayed at were very nice. Our guide Jose treated us very nicely and organized an amazing trip. The best part of the tour was the camel riding and spending the night at the Sahara desert. Definitely an unforgettable experience. One of my favorite trips without a doubt.
Morroco. Jose was extremely nice and helpful. The hotels and sights were very nice. The best parts were the camel rides and the Sahara desert. One of my favorite trips. Definetely worth it!

The Significant Tour and Country Alike. Not only is Morocco inexplicably the most diverse and different place I've ever visited but the people I met and tour i went through made the experience that much better. I would have had lots of fun without the tour but I'm more than happy I went through M.A.A. because it was the best tour I've ever taken in the best country ever.

Trip of a Lifetime. I had a lot of expectations heading into Morocco, and they were all exceeded thanks to our wonderful tour guide, Youssef. My friends and I spent a day and a half in Marrakech before we were picked up by Youssef for our three day journey through the Atlas Mountains into the Sahara. The journey to the Sahara is not a short one, but Youssef somehow managed to make it feel that way with numerous entertaining stops along the way. I learned more than I ever could have imagined walking around and talking to Youssef about the different lifestyles that we encountered. Once we finally reached the desert, we quickly climbed atop our sweet camels and rode into the sunset. It was the most beautiful thing I have ever witnessed, and it was soon topped by the breathtaking sunrise we experienced the following morning. Our night spent camping out in the Sahara is one that I will never forget, many thanks to Morocco Active Adventures!

Fantastic Experience with Morocco Active Adventures. We arranged for a 3-day private tour 5/19/15-5/21/15 starting out in Marrakech and dropping us off in Fez at the conclusion of our trip. We traveled through the High Atlas Mountains, the Todra Gorge, rode camels in the Sahara, slept in a beautiful tent out in the dessert, fed baby monkeys in cedar Forrest. It was an unforgettable experience and the highlight of our time in Morocco. We loved our tour guide Ali. He made us all feel special and took such great care of us the entire time. He was also very knowledgeable and took time to explain, inform and help us appreciate his country. I can't say enough good things about him! Thank you so much Ali! We were three women embarking on our first adventure in Morocco. Before we went we were nervous planning and thinking about things like personal safety and where we would go to the bathroom and how hot was it going to be in the dessert? We never had anything to fear. Our safety was never in question. Yes, there were bathroom stops along the way and they were always clean and what we were used to. In the dessert you had to pour water to flush the toilets but hey we were in the dessert and it was an incredible experience! The vehicle was comfortable and we had AC. The camel ride at dawn and sunset was timed for a perfect temperature outside and it was unforgettable, it helped me experience the magic of the Sahara. I have no words to describe it. It's something each person has to experience for themselves. Ali even helped arrange for a surprise birthday cake for me! It was so special. I will always remember my time in Morocco and can't wait to return. Shukran Ali and the great team at Morocco Active Adventures!
Toubkalguide. Absolutely fabulous day out to the Atlas mountains, via visit to a local market, Argan factory, lunch and camel trek. Looked after from 9-7pm brilliantly. Thank you!

Eye opener. Once inside the walls of the medina it is a real eye opener I'm a very well travelled person and this is amazing you will see and small things that you have never smelt before but I loved it just close your eves and listen and you will know you are some were very foreign

10 Day Trip Around Morocco. My partner and I are very pleased with our driver and guide. He speaks very good English and took care of us for four days as we travelled from Fez to Marakesh. The hotels and tent accommodation provided by Active Adventure was first class.We are very pleased with their professional service. I would recommend them to anyone for their next travel.

Beautiful Place Beautiful People. This has been the most amazing feeling i have ever gotten from this hotel it made me feel at home and i felt like they wanted to take care of me they spent enough time to understand my needs in the industry of hunger and would love to go back when ever i get the chance to!!!!

Lovely day trip to the Atlas Mountains. Had a lovely day with a stop to the Argan oil co-operative and to Richard Branson's kasbah, which is beautiful., our guide up the mountains Abraham was so sweet and respectful. Great day out from start to finish.
brilliant. liked it all good value for money friendly driver polite and amusing.Prompt with timing.Trip to souk an experience but you need to be wary of pick pockets although we had no problems.
Souks. Put us at ease for our first trip to the souks .booked through thomson picked up from hotel and returned.a half day tour

Excellent DayTour. I was in two minds at first about paying more for Morocco Active Adventures than my tried and tested Riad approved excursion tour company but I didn't regret it at all.Our guide was very polite and treated us not just as a friend but as family.We stopped at a Berber Village family house where they served us fresh bread and delicious mint tea. We continued through the Ourika Valley with beautiful views. By the end of the day we were overwhelmed with his hospitality as he invited us to lunch at his own family house (not part of the service folks but we were very touched by the offer).Thank you so much. We will definitely recommend.

Amazing Tour, great guide. We had a four day tour with Idir as our driver. Ali helped us to plan things and explained exactly what to expect, and Idir was a brilliant and charming guide, and safe driver.We drove from Ouarzazate to the Dades Valley and then on to Merzouga, where we rode on camels to an encampment and stayed overnight in the desert - definitely the high point of our trip. We had one horrible meal on the tour but no-one is perfect and Ali said he would take this food stop off the agenda for future clients, as he had recently had similar feedback.We paid 700 euros for three of us for a four day tour with guide / driver, two overnight stays (one in desert) and evening meals. Not cheap (for Morocco) but money well spent. Thank you Ali and Idir!
desert tour. the offered organised tours are ust fantastici didnt like at all the understanding of time , most trips start a half hour later
everything was amazing. everything was amazing weather , the natural food m the special service from the heart , very professional staff

OUARZAZATE,ZAGORA!!!!. ...we took a kombi till region Ouarzazatr,dessert and 12 of us we traveled cck 6h ...that cost us 50euro per p..so when we arrived all of us ware impressed and was wrelly ineresting to see d oldiest city tribe of berberian..we had lunch some tajine and cous cous and back to trip till Zagora...there we took our cammel and whith berberians we travel for 1h till berb.bungalows where we sleeped...so i can say everything was AMAZING and a great adventur

Fantastic trip - these guys are absolutely brilliant!. My sister and I travelled to Morocco in March and these guys really made it the trip of a lifetime! We had so much fun and definitely have Morocco Active Adventures to thank. Youssef took us on our desert trip and he was absolutely brilliant, we learnt so much about Berber culture and he made us laugh so much, we couldn't have asked for a better guide! Every Riad we stayed in was exceptional, with great food and superb hospitality. Ali picked us up in Marrakech and gave us a fantastic introduction from the minute we stepped off the plane. If you are going to Morocco definitely go with this company - we cannot fault them at all. Thank you so much Morocco Active Adventures! (Emily & Hannah, UK)
Great value. Fantastic to get around and about,great sights to see and value for money...a must when visiting great service
City bus. Great to get a feel for the place. And you could get on and off as much as you liked. Good a d clean bus with great drivers and on time! Not like GB!
Day trip to High Atlas Mt. Breathtaking views of the countryside. Had a lunch with a local Barber family which was a highlight as well

Family desert adventure. If you want to enjoy amazing landscapes of Sahara Desert and stunning view, a trek in Merzouga desert it is really must do thing in Morocco. It is ideal for relaxing and photo-shooting, the landscapes change from time to time. Take your family-friends and enjoy your time there.

Fun adventure in Morocco. I definitely recommend this excursion for a day or more in Merzouga Desert. It was the highlight of our trip to Morocco. Great day, lots of fun, very knowledgeable tour guide, he did a great job of stopping and explaining things to us. This is a fun and educational adventure. It is totally worth it and you'll be glad you did it!

Morocco Sahara Camel Riding. Really a trip and a team me and my 2 friends will never forget. It was a fantastic way to see a lot of Southern Morocco in short time. The experience was great and the tour guide we had was awesome, very friendly and great driver. You won't regret it!

Marrakech to Zagora and the Dessert Night. I was in Marrakech for only 3 days... thus, I have no time for long tour!I made one great descion: take a tour from Marrakech to Zagora for 2 day/1 night tour to th e Desert.G R E A T !It is the one of the best nights of my life!I was wake until 2am looking at the starts and walking on the desert before I returned to camp.Food and services, normal, nothing espectacular.But the desert was great!It cost me around 60 Euros, including on stop at old city in dessert... great!If you have only 2 days free in Marrakech...I would suggest this trip!But, be willing to go around (close) by your self... that was the best part!Starts is almost around the year sky...nothing can better for astronomers.. :)

Sahara Tour. We have just back from a great trip with Morocco Active Adventures. The camel ride was one of highlight of the in Morocco, also, the berber family in the cave with their children. Thank you so much.

Fantastic High Atlas Tour. I've spend 1-day with my friends in High Atlas with absolutely great tour guide - Khalid Amor. Everything was very organise and very rich in different experiences and places but with no rush - perfect for holidays where you want to relax but also experience the country and soak up all the beauty that's there :D. Was great!!! I highly recommend Khalid Amor :)

Experience of a lifetime. I loved our 2-day trip to Zagora. So much to see, so much to learn and our guide Omar made it a trip never to forget. A night under the stars in the desert, the camel trip, Ait Ben Haddou and just the amazing landscapes we passed. I will be returning to Morocco for sure

Trip To The Atlas Mountains. Be prepared with bottled water, trainers and sun protection. The views are incredible and the mountain people friendly. Try the mint tea ceremony and demonstration of bread making.

Amazing Trip. My friend and I went to Morocco for a long weekend looking for adventure and a new perspective, and we came away with so much more. We did the two-day trip to the Zagora Valley with Youssef. As two college-aged American girls traveling alone, we felt completely safe throughout the whole trip. Youssef taught us so much about the Berber lifestyle, and our experience in Morocco would not have been half as rewarding without having him as our guide. From joking and telling stories over mint tea to visiting an authentic argan oil cooperative to experiencing incredible mountain views and playing drums with Berber people around a campfire under the stars, every moment was stimulating and unforgettable. Do this tour, you won't regret it!

Got to be done. Its a must to get out of Marrakech for a day and go up to the Ourika Valley. Theres not a huge price difference between operators of tours and they are negotiable. See the Berber village and visit the Arom Mantagne factory and but some products from the female co-operative that extract the oil from the Argan tree fruit stone. Lunch is normally included but do make sure you wear sturdy footwear if your tempted to climb up to the waterfalls. Not for the faint hearted or unfit

Thank you Morocco.... ...for the wonderful memories! I recently returned form a 4 day holiday with a friend. This included as a whole 2 days in Marrakesh, where we had a 2-day trip to Zagora desert in the middle, and then back to Marrakesh. We organised the Marrakesh - Zagora trip with Morocco Active Adventures from London. Our communication with the tour agency was prompt right from the start. Our driver Ali was very friendly and well organised. He picked us up from the hotel and dropped us back there in the end.The journey was long but fun - with good conversations, beautiful scenery outside the window, and the sound of Ali's nice personal music set in the car (he even burnt a CD for us which I now listen to and remember the good time). On the way we had the chance to stop where we liked to admire the views, take pictures, have some food, see attractions like Ait Ben Haddou which is part of the UNESCO world heritage. We also had a camel ride on the way to the bivaque in the desert near Zagora where we spent the night.The people there were great and the service was wonderful. If I have to describe my experience with one word, this would be "magical". It was definitely a trip to remember and I highly recommend it!

Like a Roadtrip with Informative Friends. My friend and I took an overnight trip to the desert from Marrakech since we didn't have much time to spend in Morocco. It was the perfect trip. The guys were accommodating, informative and fun! I would recommend this experience to anyone looking for a great time.Thanks for Everything!

Great Guides for a Trip to Morocco. Just returned from a 5-day trip to Morocco, based in Marrakech. Did not know much about what to do, where to stay, or where to eat. But, with Morocco Active Adventures, there was no need to worry - they took care of everything, which was great. Sightseeing in Marrakech. Trip to the Merzouga desert. And, various other places in between.

Camel Ride. Despite being the only two on the morning camel ride we both thoroughly enjoyed the camel ride experience. Our guide was funny and even used leaves off of the trees to make us both a very artistic camel. The view itself was a bit samey but a stop at a Berber village was most enjoyable, eating the best pancakes we'd had on the trip and of course some delicious mint tea.Gentlemen wear loose trousers as it can get a bit uncomfortable!

Best Part of My Trip. My time with Morocco Active Adventures was wonderful. Everything was very well organized, professional, & informative. The time spent getting to know the locals and in the Sahara will never be forgotten. I would highly recommend Morocco Active Adventures.

Informative, safe and entertaining tour!. My sister and I recently travelled with Active Adventures out to the Moroccan Desert. Words cannot describe our experience and we decided it was not only the best country we had ever visited, but the best travel company. Our first communication with Active Adventures was prompt, precise and flexible! Joussef got back to us straight away with details and dates and options, but what was more important, he offered us advice which made us feel very safe and informed.The 4WD was clean, comfortable and very easy to travel in with plenty of room. The accommodation was all of a very very high standard. We ate beautiful, local food and were treated exceptionally well by staff at every hotel.However, what made the trip truly wonderful was our guide Youssef. Youssef went above and beyond at every point. He was our guide, our expert, and soon, our friend. Nothing was too difficult to organise, and once he knew our interests and travel preferences, he went out of his way to make sure our trip focused upon these! I can't describe how much we enjoyed our trip, and have plans to return as soon as possible. Thank you so much.

Great People great service!. Youssef and Hassan were an amazing team. I cannot recommend this tour enough. Morocco is a very special country, and these two men shared their insight and passion for their country. Going into the desert was extremely special and amazing. Berbers are a special breed of people. GO!!!!

Highly recommend. Really it was an authentic adventures. We had a trip to Sahara desert and our guide made us feel comfortable every minute of our excursion. If I visit Morocco again I will not hesitate to take another tour with this group for more time.

Marrakech Sightseeing. What an amazing experience, thank you so much to the team for the trip to the top, a dynamic young professional and friendly team. If you like authentic adventures, do not hesitate, go for it!

Amazing trip. We would like to thanks our driver for the great day trip that we had few weeks ago. Just one trip to Atlas Mountains but we had a lot to see and to visit. The breakfast with a local family is of our highlights in Morocco. Thank you again Mustafa.

Unforgettable Experience!. One of the best experience of my life! Thanks to Jose, who was the best tour guide to show us around Marruecos and this amazing culture. He took us to every place mentioned in the plan and even more places, making this trip unforgettable. He was very attentive, helpful and fun. He made us feel comfortable every minute of our trip and also he taught us a lot of words in Arabe and Berber. All the hostels we stayed were beautiful and all the employees were very respectful. For sure, if I visit again Marruecos i will not hesitate to take another tour with Jose and his group Morocco Active Adventures - Day Tours, they are the best!!
An excelente experience!. The guide tour was a nice guy. Very respectful, funny, and talkative. It's was a complete experience to know Marocco's beauty and the culture.
An excellent and memorable tour!. An unforgettable experience to enjoy the beautiful scenery of Morocco with nice guide of Morocco Active Adventures!

Best trip in my life so far!. We are a group of 4 women travellers from Hong Kong, and the 4d3n desert trip was the best we have ever had (among our experiences throughout Asia, Europe & America)! We did the trip from Marrakech to Fez, traveling in a comfortable 4x4 with nice local music & wifi (ssssh… don't tell others!) and seeing all the wonderful views of Atlas mountain, Sahara desert and above all, the unforgettable camel riding and camping under the starry sky. We were taken to a secret place for a nice picnic with amazing desert view, and we also visited berber village and nomads to know about the desert culture. They did not take you to shopping & no extra costs. Well, this maybe similar to other desert tours, but what stands out is the incredible guide & service provided by Morocco Active Adventure (MAA)!MAA was the fastest to reply my queries and I even managed to talk to them via online chat before confirming my booking! This gave me confidence on their experience and as a group of lady travellers from Asia to visit such an exotic country like Morocco, we truly value this ^v^!The guide, Youssef, is incredibly amazing, experienced and entertaining! He is knowledgeable in local culture and traditions, and makes you feel like a good old friend. You will be surprised by the talent he has got, and also find him a funny lad who shares silly jokes and full of wild ideas. We had met other travelers & their guides on our way, and we believed our experience was unique, awesome and the best! We wished we did a longer trip and spend more time in the desert!We visited in April 2013, and we are still in touch with MAA, sharing our traveling experience and others.

Quad bike in sahara. I had a great morning, learning to ride the quad and learning some amazing stories about Sahara Desert and its Berber people. I can only advise any traveller to Merzouga Desert, not to miss this unique active adventure. Highly recommended.

Take me back!!!. We did the 4 day trip and was greeted by a well presented and happy guide (the whole trip he was amazing). All local info shared was phenomenal as he was well traveled and had lots to talk on. The transport was an air conditioned 4x4, very comfortable for the 2 of us and we felt super safe with our driver and his road etiquette. Lots of driving so was very important. Accom was 4/5star and extremely happy with them. All safe clean and very nice.Sites blew us away.. One minute dry arid land the next green valleys of bliss. I must mention or aim was to get to the desert and we were impressed by the scenery on the way.Desert was amazing - exactly what I expected, beautiful serene and peaceful. Our camel rides were an hour into the camp site one night stay and back on the camel the next morning. We luckyily shared a camp site with a bunch of fun and interesting English speaking tourists which made it even nicer! Now to our guide - if you can request anyone Youssef Bani was excellent. He is a wealth of knowledge, funny and energetic and didn't fail to deliver on any of our guided tour with him! He certainly made our tour more special!! Thank you to the team and most importantly to our guide.!!

Fantastic experience. I booked a 2 day, one night desert tour from Marrakech to Zagora, then back to Marrakech. As a female solo traveler, I was a bit apprehensive about a private tour, but I need not have worried. Ali was an excellent driver, and Mohammed was a wonderful guide who made me feel safe and well-taken care of the whole time. The stops we made were interesting and beautiful, and it was nice to have the company of two men who knew the landscape and the country so intimately. As promised, we returned to Marrakech in plenty of time to pick my daughter up from the train station. My only regret is that I did not have time for a longer tour!

Unforgettable Trip with the Morroco Active Adventures!! ♥. Definitely one of the best experiences that I have had so far! They picked us up at the airport, made many many stops without rush or complained so that we could enjoy the view from different points, instruct us culturally and made sure that we were comfortable at all times. The tour guide Jose and the employees at the hotel were very helpful, respectful and available at all times. The food was AMAZING and endless! Even though the camels did hurt is an experience that should be tried at least once in your life... The night at the desert was one of the best part of the trip... There they played music with the drums and integrated us to participate, dancing and playing the instruments as well. It's something that's definitely different which makes it even better.

Best Trip ever.... Thank you Joussef, Ali and Adi for the wonderful and exciting trip from Marrakech to the Sahara and back. Joussef and his crew are doing a very good job!! I can really recommend the tours. We made the four day trip from Marrakech to quarzazate, Sahara desert and back, with nice locations in the route like canyons and a finally camel riding. Joussef gave us a nice hint for a shopping location in Marrakech and the Riads recommended by him were very very nice. We will come back!! Stefan

Awesome day with Morocco Active. Our group of 5(all girls) had our 1st visit to Morocco with Active Adventures, from start to finish it was an extremely smooth process. We did a quad bike tour in sahara desert. Our guide, makes it possible to experience some of the most amazing sights in dunes. The staff were patient and gave clear instructions on how to operate the quad bikes.Thank you to everyone at Morocco Active Adventures, you guys made our day awesome!!!

Safe Adventure.... Saiid took the time to give us(two women travellers) the true Moroccan experience during our visit to Marrakesh. We enjoyed the customized tour that Saiid planned for us, and had an excellent experience overall. Thank you so much.Angela + Laura

Meet a different world!. Traveling is transported to another time and Morocco is no the exception. For known and enjoy a place in his totally, you need to experience everything that characterizes it, the people, the food, the scenery, the weather, the music, the culture and tradition; all this I experienced this past summer with the help og our guide Jose. I recommend this trip to anyone waiting for a new experience, I assure you that you will not regret.

The best in my Morocco trip. Just a quick note to say how pleased we were the last week of our trip with Morocco Active Adventures. A quad bike in Merzouga dunes, is an ideal adventure among friends and families, I recommend to everyone !!

Unforgettable, exciting and unique. Unique landscapes, best food in the world (don't be afraid to try it all), the best tour guide and the desert is just breath-taking. I went with a group of six girls and we felt completely pampered, safe and entertained. Also, we learned so much from Morocco because of our guide, José Aventuras. He vas awesome and considerate at all times. Even one girl, whose birthday we spent in the desert, he went and bought a cake for her and surprised us all. It was just beautiful. A MUST-DO FOR EVERYONE. May the desert steal you like it stole me. Thanks for everything José :D

Marroco unbelievable place. My girlfriend and me enjoyed with this amazing company! Great staff, really friendly and have a lot of experience is the activity. The tour was unbelievable, the guide is amazing, great english and he gave us a lot of confidence on our first dives. I highly recommend to do the adventures activities with this company.Thank you guys we had a wonderful time with you.

We went to Morocco. I went to Morocco with my girlfriend as part of our honeymoon and we had a great experience. It was one of the most valuable experiences in our lives. The night at the dessert was unbelievable, The food always was good. we recommended it 100%.

Once in a lifetime experience, worth doing again!. What can I say that hasn't already been said? We did the 4 day 3 night trip from Marrakech to Fes. Such an amazing trip in large part because of Joussef. He made you feel like an old friend, not just a client on a structured tour. From Ait Ben Haddou, to the Toudgha Gorges, to the guest house in Ramlia (middle of no where!) to the camel trek for the overnight stay in the Sahara (where you can't help but sing that song by the Police in your head as you have some tea) to the Barbary Apes (monkeys) in the cedar forest of Azrou. It's an adventure full of nonstop excitement, learning and cultural expansion. My girlfriend at the time always talked about doing things to "make your world bigger". Taking this trek definitely fulfills that mantra.

Lifetime Experience. On October 2013 I went to Morocco with my husband as part of our honeymoon and I had a great experience. First, I was a little scared since it was only both of us and the tour guide and we did not have any internet or GPS so we did not know where we were going, but it was one of the most valuable experiences in our lives. Hotels where really great! The night at the dessert was unbelievable. Tour guides are really trustful. We didn’t know in which hotels we are going to stay before arriving, but I really love them. The food was good always. The last day we leave our luggage with the tour guide and he was going to take them to another tour guide since he has to go to another tour and we already pay. Our tour guide told us that at a specific time the other tour guide will pick us with our luggage and ride us to the airport. We trust him as always and at that specific time the other tour guide pick us and ride us to the airport. I really blessed for this opportunity. I recommended it 100%.

Cause this is Africa ♫. Every time someone asks me about my euro-trip, I always talk first about my trip to Morocco even if Morocco is in Africa and not in Europe because the countries in Europe are all pretty much the same, churches, beautiful architecture, bridges, trains, parks, blabla, but Morocco is so different. Deserts, giant rocks, sandstorms, delicious food, beautiful clothes and jewelry and amazing views. I went with 5 boricua friends and we had a blast with Youssef (Jose). We spent 2 nights in beautiful hotels and 1 night in the Sahara Desert. Seeing the sunrise in desert was astonishing. Jose taught us a lot about Morocco and its culture and traditions and showed us a beautiful part of his country. Thank you for everything Jose!! You're an amazing person! I recommend this tour 1000%.

Experience of a lifetime. I spent a short weekend with these guys, and they did the best job. I got to see so much of their beautiful country for a great price, and I still think about it everyday. You will no doubt leave this experience with memories and people you will hold close to your heart. I wish I could live it all again!

Trip of a lifetime. This was far and away the best trip I have had. The tour guide was incredible. Not only did he take us to our destination but he gave us so much insight into the local culture along the way. We learnt the language, and experienced the highlights. Atlas Mountains, desert...all incredible. Would recommend this company to anyone. A MUST do.

Bucket List Experience of a Lifetime. Four of my friends and I wanted to get out of Morocco as much as possible, in the least amount of time and without ending up so broke! We came across the tour and our assigned tour guide, Joussef, made us feel welcome since before we even accepted to take the tour! He was always very attentive with the flight and transportation arrangements so our once in a lifetime trip would be exactly just this... and more! We were picked up straight from the airport in a really comfortable 4x4 and started our journey into the desert, which consisted of just enough sightseeing mixed with adventure. We rode camels in the Sahara Desert, sandboarded (Yes!, you read correctly!), had an incredible feast in the middle of the desert, sang and danced to traditional music, gazed at the vastness of the night sky and even got to see a Saharan sunrise. Just absolutely memorable experiences that I will forever cherish! Youssef treats you like and old friend and will go out of his way to make his guests feel at home. Recommend this tour or a longer one (depending on your interests and budget) without giving it a second thought!

The best trip in my life - el mejor viaje de mi vida. A really great experience, spent the night at the Sahara's Desert are unforgettable. The staff was really nice and kind. They make me feel in home. The camel trip to the desert was fun. I recomend this company 100%. I'm in love with Morocco thanks to Jusef.Una gran experiencia, pasar la noche en el desierto es inolvidable. El equipo es muy bueno y generoso. El viaje en Camello al desierto fue divertido. Recomiendo esta compañia al 100%. Gracias a Jusef estoy enamorada de Marruecos.
Adventure in the Sahara. From the landing to the views, everything was perfect on our stay on Morocco. The crew was amazing, as well as the experience.. It was surreal

The best way to experience Morocco!. My friends and I did a 4 day adventure from Marrakech to Fes. It was the best way to get from one point to the other and we made so many memories along the way. Traveling in a comfortable air conditioned 4x4 was a luxury. We stopped at various destinations, slept under the stars, rode into the desert at sunset on the back of camels, sand boarded down the most beautiful dunes, and were treated to tea and music with Berbers. Experiences next to none and forever memorable in our hearts. What set the bar so high was undoubtedly our guide Joussef who catered our trip to fit our needs. He is extremely knowledgeable about his country and the culture, speaks many different languages, and treats you like good friends. It is well worth doing this tour to get a unique Morrocon adventure. I only wished we did a longer trip.

Great Adventure. My son and I made a great personalized trip into the dessert of Morocco. Quad biking, sleeping in the dessert, beautiful sun rise and sun set, tea with berbers, rock climbing. Our guide Joussef was extremely helpful and entertaining. We can heartily recommend Morocco Active Adventures.
