Camel trekking in Sahara. This was my first trek ever. It took us 03 day in sahara desert and was more than everything I imagined. I would definitely recommend taking this trip from Marrakech and heading up to see both the mountains and desert.Thank you so much M.A.A

New Adventure. I had the best time with this company... Driving in off-road and dunes, I believe I have found another adventure that is just as exciting and so much fun. Try it, you will not regret it. Thank you Active Adventures for the great trip!!!

An experience I will never eveeer forget!. The whole trip is something out of this world. Morrocco is such a magical place and we would have been completely lost if it werent for these guys. Jose (one of the guides) was the best! We had little time to be in the desert and he made it posible for us to see everything in just two days. We were always taken good care of anywhere we went. It truly is one of the best trips I have ever done and I would totally recomend it to everyone!

2 Day Trip to Zaggora Dessert. Two of my roommates and I went on a one night and two day trip, and it was amazing! Our guide (Youseff) picked us on time at the airport, drove us for 6-7 hours from Marrakech to Zaggora Dessert, where we stayed at a camp-like place. The camp was great. They greeted us with Moroccan tea, we had a full dinner and had a great tent to sleep in. After dinner the whole camp group learned how to play the drums around the campfire. Our guide took us up to the sand dunes and we got to see the beautiful stars. The next morning we went on a 45 minute camel ride and met up with our guide at the end of the ride. We road-tripped back to the city and on the way stopped by some of the sight-seeing places of Morocco. We got to stop by the place where they filmed Gladiator and even toured the city of that particular place. Our guide was phenomenal. He made us feel welcomed and even taught us Arabic! We learned so much from him and he answered any questions we had. The car that we drove in was plasted with music and he stopped whenever we wanted to take pictures. It was an amazing trip because my roommates and I were on a tight schedule and they were really flexible in the trip. They even set us up with an amazing riad the night before our flight. The riad was beautiful, accommodating and fed us delicious breakfast in the morning. We had a flight at 6am and the lady who lived/worked there woke up at 4am to make us breakfast. They were all so incredibly sweet. This trip was by far one of the best experiences I've had my semester abroad. We felt so safe and enjoyed every minute of this trip. There was always something exciting going on and I would recommend this trip to anyone! Youseff, thank you so much for an amazing trip!! You are the best!

Fantastic Excursion. We took the 3 day tour to Dades valley and Ait Ben Haddou, camels and night in Merzouga and finally to Ouarzazate. They put us up in top notch hotels and the accommodations exceeded our expectations. Best of all was our driver and guide. Youssef was knowledgeable, interesting and extremely helpful. This was particularly important since there was a good amount of driving involved.

An unforgettable trip.. Thanks to this amazing tour I fall in love with this beautiful country. They offer an excellent service. I learned a lot about the culture and the country. I fall in love with the landscapes, they seem to be unreal, is like magical. Youseff is an excellent guide. He made me change my vision about the world, about everything with this beautiful trip. I definitively recommend this tour because is different and you learn more about the arabic culture. I assure you, there won't be regrets. I love Morroco and i know i will be back to see more about this fascinated country and continent. <3

Atlas mountain trip. Trip was organised by the hotel just for us. Car turned up on time. The guide was waiting at the Atlas mountain. Had a very good experience. On the wAy back came through a different way. It was such an amazing trip.

The reason why you book with Morocco Active Adventures!. We would have been lost, directionless and eventually disappointed IF we had not contacted Morroco Active Adventures for a 4 day trip. Our guide Youssef had everything organized, we had a wonderful vehicle, we went to places that were remote, exquisite, wild. Even when weather intervened, Youssef took care of us. The magical camel trip to the desert will remain imprinted in my memory forever. Visitors to Morroco have not seen this rare jewel of a country unless they travel with one of Morocco Active Adventures' guides.

Experience of a lifetime!. Definitely one of the best experiences of my life! First of all our tour guide, Jose, was amazing since the moment I contacted him to the very end of the trip. He is such a great person and tour guide, of course. You might think that the way to the dessert is long, but these people really know how to make it worth it! I learned so much from the Moroccan culture, the tour guide really know about his country and his culture, they explain everything perfectly. The scenery was incredible!! All the places we went were so beautiful and the desert I can't even explain! The places, the people, the food, everything was SO good!! The hotels they booked for us were also really good and the night we slept at the desert was probably one of the best nights of my life. It is just a magical experience! If I ever go back to Morocco (which I hope I do someday) I will definitely do this tour again! Everything was just perfect.

In love with Morocco. I can easily say that this was the best trip of my life. I learned so much about moroccan culture while enjoying the wonderful and beautiful views of the city and the desert. Youssef is an amazing person and an excellent tour guide, I'm so grateful for everything he and his team did for us. It was an amazing and unforgettable journey, without a doubt I will do this tour again someday. It was magical!

Excellent driver/tour facilitator for Marrakech and all of Morocco. Five years ago we visited Morocco with our best friends and had a wonderful tour of the country which was arranged through a travel agency. We were particularly impressed with our driver, Fedli Mohamed, who not only delivered us safely to each destination, but also saw to our every need. We recently returned to Morocco. Before we left, we contacted Mohamed directly to see if he was still with the same company since it was important to us to secure his services. We found that he was now independent and could not only drive us but also make the complete trip arrangements for us. He planned the whole trip for us, securing lodging, hiring local guides and arranging site visits. We had every bit as fantastic a trip as we did the first time and it was roughly half the price. Mohamed is honest, dependable, and dedicated to serving his clients. He is based in Marrakesh and can either do day trips from there or can take you through the whole country. He picked us up and dropped us off at the Casablanca airport. We reached Mohamed at his email address fedlimohamed@gmail.com
Fabulous tour. Youssef and the rest of the guys took such great care of us. Had such a wonderful adventure - just simply the best!

Went with a Thomsons tour. Worth taking a tour as we would never have found some of the places we visited! Make sure you go with a good tour guide, not ones that are by the entrance to the city as we were warned against these.
Mountain Trekking. Our Riad arranged a private Atlas Mountain trek with this company. Just the 2 of us and a wonderfully pleasant man with exceptional English speaking!! Amazing memories :-)

Camel ride in Sahara of Marzoga. We were in Marrakech over for a long weekend, by chance we found this company through tripadvisor and booked by email. The price was fantastic and our driver guide was very friendly, helpful and great. Thank you so much Mohamed.

Unique expreience. I can honestly say me and my wife had a unique experience, as our respectful guide gave us a very informative traveling experience about the vast culture of Marrakesh. The location for the waterfall itself is incredible. many locals diving in and bathing inside whilst others marveling the delights of the gushing streams above their heads. its quite a walk to reach the zenith point but well worth it because a little abit of sacrifice is required to reach ones destination :)

We had a great time in Morrocco!!!!. My wife and I just got back from a 14 day trip to Morocco. We really could not say enough good things about Morocco Key Travel. They arranged everything and took fantastic care of us the entire time. We have traveled to numerous other countries, and Morocco Key Travel and Ibrahim are the best. The places we stayed were all very nice. We particularly enjoyed staying in the Riads because they were beautiful and right in the historic areas. Our trip was sort of a loop around the central part of the country. We went to Rabat, Meknes, Fes, and then out to the desert. It was the best part of the trip. We spent a night in a tent camp out in the desert. Later we met some Berber Nomads, and we had tea with them. After the desert, we went to Essaouira, then to Marrakesh. Key Travel thought of everything to make our trip more enjoyable. All in all the best vacation experience we have ever had.

Brilliant Morocco Adventure!. As a young, solo female traveller I was concerned about how safe it was for me to travel in Morocco, however that concern was no longer after discovering this brilliant tour company that offered all the experiences I wanted for my trip to Morocco from Australia - 4WD, desert camping, camels, sand boarding, quad bikes, local cuisine and cooking class, learning the language etc etc. It was more expensive than the group tours I originally looked at, but so so worth it - even just for the amazing accommodation you get to stay in!! And because it is a private tour you feel safe - my tour guide, Joussef, knows everyone there, and knows everything about the areas and towns you drive through, he taught me some arabic and berber language, and your itinerary is extremely flexible. On the first night he sat me down with a giant map and gave me five different itinerary alternatives, so I picked two and we kind of made it up as we went along, it was awesome! Plus we threw in a whole lot of 4WD river crossing, desert and dune drives spontaneously. A definite 5-star experience for anyone wanting an active-style adventure in Morocco!

Best Tour in Morocco. Earlier last month I booked a last minute trip to Spain along with two friends. While the planning unfolded we contemplated venturing south to Morocco. After booking a four day trip to Marrakech we were realized that if we were going down to Morocco we might as well go out to the Sahara and see the dunes right? Yes, that escalated quickly. It just so happens that from Marrakech the three mayor dune systems are 7.5 hours to Zagora and 10 hours to either Erg Chigaga or Erg Chebbi (BEST DUNES in terms of size, vastness and greatness). At first we were a little skeptical about spending 20 hours driving back and forth from the desert in a four day/3 night trip but "when in Rome..." Well we found out that most excursion companies that we contacted refused to take us since we wanted to do to much in too little time. Marrakech Tour Excursions was one of the few that were willing to take us out. This good initial impression never faded away proved to be accurate. From the pick up to the drop off back our driver, Hamid, was very professional, friendly and knowledgeable. We were picked up from Hostel Riad Marrakech Rouge in a very comfortable and I would say upscale Toyota Prado SUV. The added comfort of the personalized tour and the vehicle made the long drive something truly enjoyable. Between the conversations with Hamid and sightseeing from Marrakech to the desert the ride was well worth it. During the ride out you get to see changes in landscape from dry Marrakech to deciduous forest a you go up the Atlas Mountains up to the snow-covered peaks and back down eventually passing Ouarzazate (Moroccan Hollywood) and from there dissecting painteresque towns all the way to the desert. Once we arrived to Erg Chebbi we had the camels, or dromedaries as we learned is the proper name for the one-humped Saharan camel, and our desert guide Said waiting for us ready to go. We got out there just in time for the sunset as we trekked our way out to the Berber camp. Upon arriving I was favorably surprised by the facilities at the camp. The camp consists of a series of huts lined up one next to the other in typical Berber fashion. They even have a restroom set up out there in the desert! That night Said cooked for us the best tagine (chicken) which we had during the whole trip. After supper we went off to build a fireplace and Said played the tbe and bendir (berber drums) and chanted traditional folkloric music of the region. Next morning we we up before sunrise to see the sunrise above the sea of dunes. Once up we were left free to roam the surrounding dunes and sandboard our way to exhaustion. After this we camel trekked our way back to Merzouga while contemplating the vastness and perfectly shaped dunes. Once back at the town Said took us to the Hotel where we had a very good and filling breakfast followed by a shower before heading back to Marrakech. All in all if you can't judge by my experienceI am HIGHLY recommending going out to the desert and Marrakech Tour Excursions made this all possible for us. This is a great opportunity to witness the greatness of nature and immerse themselves in a completely foreign culture. This is why along with the great treatment we were given I would strongly suggest you contact them if you are contemplating any trip around Marrakech. Even if you are not going out to the desert they offer different tours like the Tour of the Imperial Cities in which they take you around different cities in northern Morocco. I cannot emphasize this enough, they are professional, amiable and easily approachable. If I were to go again I would definitely contact them.

A lifetime experience. My friends and I went on a trip to the desert with Marrakech Tours Excursions. We really wanted to go into the desert but didn't have that much time. We contacted Joussef and he arranged a custom trip that was perfect for our needs (2 days/1 night from Marrakech to Merzouga/Erg Chebbi). Hamid, our experienced driver, picked us up early in the morning in a very comfortable air-conditioned 4x4. We arrived at the desert just before sunset and took a camel ride into the Erg Chebbi Dunes for approximately 1 hour. We spent the night in a traditional berber camp, where Said, our friendly host, prepared some traditional tajine for us. The next day we had a great time sandboarding. The price for the tour was very reasonable. I highly recommend M.T.E. to everyone.

Wonderful private tour. My family had an absolutely wonderful 4 day trip into the desert. We contacted Youssef about a trip from Fes to Marrakech and he arranged a wonderful itinerary. In particular, our guide Omar was excellent; he had a great eye for sights and obviously knew the area extremely well. As we learned, he grew up in the region where we traveled, and his love for the area really shone through during our trip. He showed us local schools and businesses they were helping to support, and it was really touching to see him and Youssef giving back so much to the Berber communities where they grew up. We spent a night out in Berber tents in the Sahara, another night far off the beaten track in the desert (after a day of off-roading), and a third night in the Dades Valley. Our driver was excellent as well; never once did I feel like we were unsafe or out-of-control, even though we drove nearly 100km through the desert with no roads in sight.The price of the trip was incredibly reasonable -- much cheaper than if we had tried to book individual hotels and travel. More importantly, the company and the guide treated us like family, helping us bargain, recommending local specialties, and sharing stories from their own lives and experiences. No one ever pushed us to buy anything, unlike the guides in Fes and Marrakech. I will certainly be recommending this company to everyone I know traveling to Morocco. One note: the desert areas we visited get quite cold in January, so bring warm clothes!

Highlight of our trip!. My husband and I adored M.T.E's tour into the desert!!!That's due in huge part to our wonderful tour guide and driver, Joussef. It feels like going on a road trip with a good friend - he really went out of his way to make sure our journey felt easy, effortless and personal. Originally from a Berber village in the desert we were exploring, Joussef introduced us to his mother, brothers, and extended network of Aunties. We were invited to have lunch and tea with them, a wonderful glimpse into Berber life. His mom even made us a special drink to try to help calm our rumbly tummies. Joussef's English is excellent, and he was able to answer even our most obscure questions, point out things we could never get from a guide book (try and learn the special hand signal for Berber independence!) and introduced to some pretty amazing contemporary African music (a must for a long, desert road trip). Part of the trip was spent off-roading into the desert, where we really felt like we were the only people for miles and miles. It was a special treat to get to fully experience the silence and remoteness of the landscape. Riding the camels was delightful, and not just some posed picture - we must have ridden the camels for an hour at sunset into the Erg Chebbi, the magnificent dunes of the Sahara. Not once were we pushed to buy anything - a huge relief from the tour guides in the cities. We highly recommend M.T.E. and Joussef for a really personal POV of Morocco.

Hire a taxi from the street. Make the tours with a private taxi driver. just find a taxi that is more like a mini van; his car more like a new one, and the cost will be much cheaper than your hotel tour. All drivers know the points of interest and will be glad to take you on tour. We went to the five water falls and climbed up the mountain. It was a great day if not the best.There is also the hop on hop off tour bus the we take in every city we visit. It is a good ride between the main tourists attractions and you get to see the city in ease.

Relax and enjoy. I've found this company on the tripadvisor - my first intuition was that I could trust these people and they didn't disappoint me... I told Youssef what our idea was and he organized everything for us - they were very flexible to rearrange the whole trip when our luggage were delayed - not to mention the help they provided to get the lost baggage back.We had a great guide, Abdul - he treated us as family (no exaggeration), took us everywhere, recommended original local places to eat and enjoy, told us interesting stories about everyday life, helped bargaining, but waited patiently when needed... Thanks again, Abdul!I would choose this company again - they listen to your wishes and make your dream come true - even if that seems impossible :-)
Ouzoud waterfalls. amazing.. bring your swimming suite.. don't settle for the first restaurants near the parking.. there are other with breathtaking view on the way down

Excellent. We went on several trips organised through click excursions which were fabulous, first one was to the desert for 2 days & 1 night, so pleased we did have private 4x4 car as wouldn't really want to travel 7 hours in a mini bus with other people, had wonderful driver called Hakim who went out of his way to take us to Ben Hadou where alot of films are made i.e Gladiator & Prince of Persia, then on to where they process the argan oil. Camped in the desert overnight with the Nomads, camel ride was around 2 hours!!Second trip was to the amazing waterfalls that are over 330 feet high, Mohammed took us around there and as he grew up there was very knowledgable about the area, a real piece of paradise, an absolute must to go to!! even got to see monkeys very close up!! CLICK EXCURSIONS

Wonderful 5-days trip. We contacted Marrakech Tour Excursions before flying to Marrakech and they planned for us a 5-days trip starting from Marrakech and including some of the most amazing places in that part of Morocco. We visited Ouarzazate, the amazing Gorges and of course The Desert! Our guide, Amar, was more than a simple guide. We always had the feeling of having a friend with us. He was very open with us and he explained to us everything he could about Morocco and Berber history and culture. We also had very interesting discussions about different cultures in our world and especially in Marocco. In addition he was also a wonderful guide, having all the time something to explain to us on every place we visited. Both him and our driver were also very professional, always in time and open to any request from us. Every expence was clearly explained in advance and we didn't spend even 1 dirham more than what we planned. I would definitely recommend this experience to anyone who wants to discover what Morocco really is. This is an experience for real travellers, other than simple tourists. Take this chance, you won't regret it!

Great day trip. We hired a guide and a 4 x 4, the trip was very interesting and the guide very knowledgeable. The car was very comfortable and the views spectacular. We also visited two waterfalls of the five set in the hills

Full day Atlas mountain tour. Was a truly amazing day! We arranged the tour via our Riad - The Riad Elizabeth. We were taken to various mountains, lakes, Richard Branson's Retreat called Kasbah Tamadot, the Berber Village and inside a Berber home aswell as a Berber restaurant where we had dinner with a waterfall in front of us. The experience was absolutely breathtakingly brilliant, the best day in Morocco by far! The scenary and landscape is just beautiful - so peaceful and magnanimous in all its glory. Definitely worth going on a full day tour of the Atlas mountains.

Ourika Valley and the waterfalls. After reading reviews for those who stayed at Diwane Hotel (recommended by the way); we opted for a day trip via the tourist information centre. We had a private car and a guide for the waterfalls bit too.Our only downside was that it was not made clear we had to pay the guide too for the waterfalls, thankfully we had enough money. The trip was 500 dirhams and our guide for the waterfalls charges 300.It really depends what you are after but if you are the Guilez area, pop over the tourist information centre to organise a trip.My favourite part of the holiday, and I am glad we did not go on a group excursion which we found would cost a lot more.

..a private tour of Marrakech is well worth doing at the start of your trip here.. We have just had a great 3 hour tour of the main city attractions. Boy what it worth it!There is no way we could have had just great insight to the city on our own. We now feel set up to explore the whole area on our own - well armed for the market traders!Beware though! It seems that all the guides take you 'favourite' stores for your own personal tutorial about spices, carpets, trinkets and such. They are all just an excuse to sell you there wares. Non threatening but the carpet store manager was a formidable salesman that would well in any secondhand car dealership!Oh, and our guide warned us not to allow any of the sideshow snake charmers to place a snake around your neck for a picture - unless of course you don't mind negotiating the fee of the picture before he takes it off you!Anyway, do the guided tour!
Marrakesh by Air. An early start, but well worth it. Seeing the sun rise over the Atlas Mountains from a hot air balloon is an experience not to be missed.

Recommended Private Tour Guide. We arranged a private tour with Senhaji Zaher through the La Mamounia Hotel. He took five of us through the Medina, the Mellah and the Kasbah. He is extremely knowledgeable of the history, culture, customs and he explained everything in excellent English. He has a sense of humour that was exhibited in all of the discussions he held.His email address is senhajizaher1@yahoo.fr
Ourika valley. It was a one day excursion that was a excellent quiet moment outside of the city, mother nature was great as usual and the calm was outstanding

Mountains to Mohammed. We did three tours into the Atlas Mountains, two with local guides called Mohammed. Ourika valley was a quick and exerted 50 minutes unto the falls and back down. Great guide. Ouzoud falls was superb to see and well worth a long day out - 3 hours there and back. We also did a walk at Imlil with a guide which can be as long as you want.
Evening excursion. Visiting the city of Marrakech is definitely one to be had.. You need your wits about you at all times
maison yves saint laurent marrakech. we went to maison yves saint laurent marrakech it was great traveled by a carriage beautiful loved the horses

Essauroi - the port. Lovely place. Golden sands, but a fish port. Medina was lovely not harassed like in marrakech and a good tour, very smelly but a fun day out. Was interesting to see people in everyday life, haggle and go up to about 1/4 of what they ask for, prine example fake sunglasses-wanted 100dinar, got them for 3. The views from the fort are excellent, has amazing history and been used in the filming of othello
Atlas Mountains, Souk. Atlas mountains are stunning. Amazing view but only for strong and able bodied people. Soul-market are full of fantastic goodies but you have to bargain a lot.

Tours organised by Hotel Ryad Mogador. We went on a few tours. The Atlas Mountains is a must as you visit a lot of authentic barber villages on route and it is the true Morocco. We also went to the coastal fishing village of Essaouira. Very pretty and had a wonderful lunch of fresh fish at a restaurant there. Visited Agadir but not that impressed as it was a holiday resort with very little character.
Marrakech palaces and souks. Great guide told us so much about the history and it was lovely to wander the streets investigating the city. You can do 2 half days but combining the 2 is a nice day out
city tour. Take a city carriage ride it was really great to see all the city in this way (better than in a taxi)
Mountains/Waterfalls. We did a day trip out to the mountains, which was stunning. We swum in the waterfalls and scaled a mountain with the help of our lovely guide.

Atlas mountains - great trip. We had an excellent tour guide called Yousef and he couldn't have been more helpful and knowledgeable. He stopped when we wanted to and we had a really good trip from 9:00 - 15:00 with a good lunch included (although too much food for us at lunch time). Definitely recommend this trip.

Ourika Valley Tour. We began our trip to Maarakesh with the half day tour of the city - it was worth it to orientate ourselves but to be honest I think that most of the places we visited, my partner and I would've found with ease and the map from our riad.However, we took a trip to Ourika Valley a couple of days later that completely outweighed the city tour. Our guide Sa'ad (not sure the spelling is spot on!!) was funny and informative. Along the journey to the waterfalls, passing spectacular views, he told us lots of interesting facts about the mountains, Berber culture and gladly answered any questions we had. Sa'ad took us for a little optional off-roading which made our palms sweat!! But, it was fun and he was a great driver even in windy steep parts of the journey. The waterfall itself was nice, but, as it's the height of summer, the water was a little low. We had lunch in a restaurant that the company use regularly and it was fine. There were tables where we could dangle our feet in the river, if we so wished, to relieve ourselves of the heat. Our only regret was not booking a 3 day tour into the desert particularly if we'd had the same guide, as he was great. Thank you for wonderful day. Well worth the money!!

go where you want to go. After touring the medina and souks of Fes, Marrakech was repetitive on a grander scale. Our private guides showed us the newer sections of the city that have boutiques cropping up everywhere. Unbelievable progress underway. Went into small private collections not mentioned in guide books.

Efficient, tour was exactly as described.. We did a day tour out to the Ouzoud waterfalls. The driver and guide were ten minutes early, and then we were off. It was really worthwhile to have a private tour, and to have something organised from this end before you go. (Youseff is very good at getting back to you by email to organise it all before you set off). I paid a deposit by Paypal, and paid the rest at the end of the tour. Nice and simple. Dirhams or Euros are fine.The trip is long, but definitely worth it when you get there. We trekked about, had something to eat, and then when we were done, we found them and we could go back home. SO nice not to have to wait for a busload of lemmings to finish.Our guide Ismail was very chatty and taught us a lot about how Rammadan works and the Berber people. On the way back I think we all dozed a bit (apart from the driver!!). We could stop to take some pcitures of things that grabbed us on our way (so a cattle bartering market, or a french fortress). Nothing was too much trouble. Ismail's English was excellent.The driver didnt speak much English but he seemed obliging enough. It might be pricier than arranging a cab to take you there and back, or to do a bigger tour group. For us, though, this was totally worth it.

The best experience ever. This was the best tour I ever made. The tour guide was very kind and funny. The people, food, service, price...everything was perfect! I just can't wait to do this tour again!! 100% recommended.

Best Travel Experience in Morocco. Merzougha is roughly a 7-8 hour drive from Fes through the Mid and High Atlas Mountains. It is the best way to see large sand dunes. You arrive and then take a 1-1.5 hour camel ride into the dunes. Many choose to overnight in the dunes with an organized tour. Many options are available from many of the local hotels in and around the area. It is possible to have part of your group stay in a hotel and part of your group spend the night in the dunes. We have arranged and sent many groups to Merzougha and many say they prefer to stay one extra day in the large dunes. You can climb the dunes, snowboard down the dunes. The best time to go is April/May. The summer time gets too hot. Groups find it comfortable to do an overnight in during December and Jan. It is worth mentioning that this is a longer drive from Marrakech and cannot be reached in one day. You can visit small dunes in a city called Zagora which is about a 7 hour drive from Marrakech, yet the dunes there are not even in the same category as the ones in Merzougha.
Marroco. The Adventure trips to Morrocco has been one of most unforgettable trips in the world. it is a trip filled with unforgettable and exciting moments. I'd recommend anyone to go on this trip.

Unforgettable experience!!. -Great tour guides -Good food-Beautiful Hotels-Mind blowing site seeing -Let me just say the I stayed overnight in the Sahara desert and did not sleep because I was in awe of the amazing night sky. We all then saw the sunrise and it was a moment that I will never forget. You learn about the culture of the desert and just embrace the peacefulness of standing in a sea of sand. -Amazing!

Ridiculously awesome!. This was probably one of the best experiences of my life. I did a three day tour with three of my friends, and I am so glad we picked this. Our guide's name was Youssef and he was awesome! He met is in Marrakech, and from there we began an amazing three day adventure. A beautiful hotel on the first night, a night in the desert on the second, and on the third day we ended up in Fes. I seriously wish we could have done more time in the desert. I can't describe the amazing views, the amazing experience, it was truly unforgettable.I loved our off-road adventures, and our drives through various Berber villages. It's something that you truly have to experience at least once in your life.Make sure that you get Youssef and his driver (forgot his name.....yikes) for this. Truly worth the money!

Ourika Valley with Morocco Sports. I was in Marrakech on business and had just a free day for the sight, then I booked a day trip to Ourika Valley with this company. I had an excellent experience with a private guide/driver(Mohamed) in his comfortable 4x4, he was friendly, knowledgeable, and FUN! Thank you so much. Sure I will be back with my family for a sahara trip.Will

Off-Road Adventures Tour. My girlfriend, other two friends and I recently returned from Morocco. One highlight from the trip was the Off Road Adventures Tour. It was great fun travelling in the dunes and through the berber villages by ATV, it's a good way the enjoy the beauty of sahara. Mohamed, was our tour guide, he was easy to talk to and ensured that everyone was enjoying themselves along the way. The quadbike or ATV, is a must do for anyone travelling to Morocco!!

Go Morocco Sports. Our family has kayaked with Morocco Sports for one day in the whitewater, the experience was amazing and great, the unique thing that we realise it in October and the water is little cold but it’s very fun adventure. Thank Mohamed

Morocco trip and sahara camel ride. My family and I have just back yesturday from a trip with MTE. We had such a great time. We were a little nervous initially about going to Morocco and to africa in general, because of all what happening in Mali and Algeria but we need not have worried. Our stay in Marrakech and sahara camel ride was great, so we recommend the team for averyone who wants to expeience the real Morocco.Thank you again

Special Experience. Riding camel, sleeping in the big tent, watching the sky fulled of stars and singing around the Campfire. This is a experience I have never had before. Everyone should try it and will fall in love with Sahara. Haha~~

Moroccan trip. Last October, we travelled to Morocco with them and had a wonderful time from the start. We were met by Mohamed in the airport, who introduced us to our wonderful guide Said in Marrakech. Our experience was great especially the camel ride in Erg Chebbi sand dunes. We encourage everyone to do it.

Amazing Experience in Sahara and Marrakech. We have just back from our amazing experience in Morocco. Our trip was one of the best trip for our honeymoon in Marrakech and an overnight in a berber tent enjoy with thousand stars. Dont miss it!!!

Amazing introduction to the Saharas!. We booked a 4-day tour from a group of 3 young professionals from Fes to Marrakech, and it was by far the best part of our month-long travel in Southern Europe and North Africa. Our guide Joussef was a very friendly and knowledgeable host, with a comfortable Landcruiser that took us to the depths of the desert & close contact with the local Berber culture. Definitely recommended for travellers who want to check out the desert - couldn't have been a better experience!

Ourika valley. Me and my husband did a day trip to ourika valley during an extremely hot day of July. Yousef was our guide and Mohamed was the driver. With these gentlemen we felt so safe and provided us with all answers of our many questions because we were really excited by the local culture of amazir people. Besides, the SUV was very comfortable with AC which really gave us a release from the burning heat. If you are heading to Morocco don't hesitate to book with MTE team. You will get the best of what Morocco can offer.

Excellent Day With Morocco Sports. Me and my girlfriend spent an amazing day in Essaouira with Morocco Tours Excursions. Our tour guide Youssef was such great and full of fun gentleman. He let you have all stops for pictures. the day was so busy and we had the chance to see the cooperation of argan oil and had the best fish lunch in the medina. Follow our advice and book your day trip and more with this company, I assure you that you will not regret for that.
Amazing experience. I've been in Morocco three months ago and I couldn't ask for a better experience. Great team, very helpful people!

Super friendly guide!. My girlfriend and I went on an excursion to the ouzoud waterfalls, what a sight. The guide spoke very good English, was super friendly and even helped us book some coach tickets. I highly recommend them!
Sahara Adventure. Amazing experience that you will never forget! Everyone should try it!

Sahara at its best!. Simply put, it's the best experience you'll have in many years to come. You'll go to the best stops with the best views, stop at good restaurants, stay in comfortable hotels with great service and, finally, the big night at the Sahara! Easily one of the best things I've done in my life; don't miss it!

Night in the desert. This was a once in a lifetime experience; truly amazing. We traveled around very cool sights around Morocco like the Atlas Mountains, beautiful gorges, and finally the Sahara. The night at the desert was the best part of the trip. We traveled to an oasis on dromedaries, ate typical moroccan tangine, climbed to one of the tallest dunes in Morocco, and slept under the stars. Youssef and the crew were very nice and helpful throughout the trip and they took us to good restaurants and good hotels. I would recommend this experience to anyone.

sahara trip. Several years ago, my sister and I would like to take a desert tour trip to Morocco to find out its breathtaking landscape. We found Marrakech Tours and Excursions online and we booked 04 day trip from Marrakech to Fes. Our funny guide his name is Youssef. I can’t say enough wonderful things about his team and the experience they provided for our adventure in Morocco, as 02 girls, travelling to Sahara desert, the tour was better than we could ever have imagined with this friendly guides, take us into incredible scenery, keeping all of us safe without pushing us into doing things we didn't want! If you are looking for an excellent service and amazing trip in Morocco, M.T.E is your place. 110% recommended
